description:
For the first time, I ate a soft shell taco in SF that didn't overwhelm! I ordered a chicken taco with beans and guacamole. The ingredients were perfectly seasoned and I didn't feel the heat of chilis at all, despite bracing for a kick at the end of each bite. 

The crew was friendly too. When I go to the Golden Gate Park again, I'll try to stop by to say hi and to eat a different item on the menu.
author: Rochie C.

description:
The food is actually pretty tasty BUT...
I order often using the delivery service, Caviar.
I've ordered probably a dozen times and every time (with one exception) my order has been missing items or just plain incorrect. What the hec?! This does not happen with any other restaurant I order on Caviar. 

The only time my order has been correct was when I called in right after placing my order online, basically pleading with them to double check that the food matches the order receipt.  I order when i'm slammed at my work and don't have time to call them everytime.... hence, the reason I order online. 

It's a shame because the food is tasty and hits the spot, but it's so frustrating when I almost never receive my order correctly. Such a simple fix, yet, bad service seems to be common here per other reviewers :-(

Manager, perhaps review the basics with staff?? I'd love to remain a customer if I receive my orders correctly.
author: Sam C.

description:
The appearance of the food looks great, but don't let that trick you into believing it tastes as good as it looks. The carnitas was dry and the meat was flavorless. 

The guac, pico de gallo, beans and rice were also flavorless. It seriously needed a dash of seasoning. The chips and salsa - is just chips and pico de gallo not real salsa. 

For 4 "Gordo Plates" and 1 "Burrito" including 5 dinks + chips and salsa, the total was 56$ which is the only reason I'm giving this location 2 stars instead of 1. Seriously take your money elsewhere and get some good tasting food. If you've got a tasteless pallet, this is your spot. Highly recommend you avoid this place. 

From a Houstonian.
author: Jody J.

description: Everything was bland. They were very conservative with the hot sauce. The salsa for the chips had literally zero flavor.
author: Kaizer D.

description:
For our weekly Friday office lunch, I decided to have Gordo's. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on March 16th around 12:15pm.

*Grilled Chicken Tacos: 4 inch corn tortilla with chicken, pico de gallo, Green Sauce (Spicy), no beans ($3.85)
*Chile Verde Tacos: 4 inch corn tortilla with chile verde (pork), pico de gallo, Green Sauce (Spicy), no beans ($3.85)
*Beef Tacos: 4 inch corn tortilla with steak, pico de gallo, Red Sauce (Medium), no beans ($4.25), Add Cheese (+$0.85)
*Chips and Salsa: Fresh housemade tortilla chips with spicy pico de gallo salsa ($5.10)
*Guacamole: Fresh housemade guacamole ($1.95)

I've been to both Gordo Taqueria locations in the Richmond and I don't remember the tacos being this hefty. There was a good amount of meat in all of them. I liked that they gave us sides of salsa instead of putting it in the actual taco. That way, they didn't get soggy. The grilled chicken and beef tacos both had a good smokiness. The pork was tender. The salsa with the chips was a nice big portion. Though I did wish I could just order the side of salsa as I am not eating deep fried food right now. The chips ended up tossed as I just wanted a side of salsa. The guac was okay. I've had better, but it added a nice creaminess to the tacos.

Great place to grab some tacos. The rest of my coworkers also enjoyed their burritos and plates. Good hefty portions. We were all in a Mexican food coma afterwards. Not sure if that's a good or bad thing, but at least we got our money's worth!
author: Elena N.

description:
I've been a faithful customer since high school (25 years), and Gordo's has never disappointed... until now. I don't know if they've changed owners, but whatever the case may be, their portions have gone down significantly. I'd usually get their Gordo plate or super burrito with everything in it, but their plates are skimpy and there's nothing super about their "Super burrito" (size of my phone). 

Gordo is Spanish for "Fat". Unfortunately, they've lost value to their name and I won't be coming back to this Gordo location.
author: D L.

description: I can't order my food if they don't answer their phone! They never answer the phone for take out orders and when I went in person to order, the staff was very rude when I asked them why nobody ever answers the phone.
author: Tyler P.

description:
It's been awhile since I've been to any of the Gordon's locations but this one especially.  Prices have gone up and quality has noticeably gone down.  The carnitas was dry and bland.  Pico de Gallo has no flavor.  We tried both the red hot sauce and the spicy green one.  The green one packed heat and was better than the gross red one.  To top it off I ended up getting the only guy there who didn't wear gloves.  WTF, the other two employees making burritos were.  Why not him?  Should I have said something.  Plus, he was horrible at listening.  I said several times, regular carnitas burrito no beans and he kept having to ask me at every step of the process what I wanted, and I repeated myself multiple times when he asked me if I wanted mild salsa and if I wanted anything else.  

It barely gets two stars over one, but decided to be a little nicer with two due to the friendly cashier and for it being pretty much the one of very few "fast" Mexican spots in the Sunset.
author: Cat C.

description: This location should be renamed to Delgado's. After my latest visit, you will never get fat from these portion sizes. I could not believe they had the guts to charge $7 for a veggie burrito the size of a Taco Bell bean burrito. I don't know who trained this burrito guy (I don't blame him), but when I saw him dish out the black beans like they were caviar, and then stop, I knew I had come come to the wrong Delgado's.its simply not enough food.
author: Jane S.

description: These tacos are loaded up with a lot of whatever you choose as toppings.  I highly recommend carnitas as your meat selection weather you get a taco or burrito.
author: Joshua B.

description: I gave this place a chance despite its rating because it was on the way home and Mexican sounded good. I had the super carnitas burrito that had rice and beans in it. I think it also had sour cream or cheese--but it was a little dry so if it did it wasn't enough. The carnitas were also not really juicy and flavorful. I also order chips and guacamole but they forgot to put the guacamole in the bag. They were definitely trying to get people in and out even though it wasn't that busy when I went.
author: Barbara N.

description: This restaurant is a chain store. And the burrito they made is juicy and delicious. Just this is slightly more expensive, the size is not enough. I ordered the super burrito which include steak rice cheese sour cream. There is extra charge for avocado. Another store on Clement St I had been. There is always a long line to wait for order.
author: Yingying C.

description:
Gordo's is a Bay Area's burrito haven. Gordo's is everywhere! I've eaten at my fair share of Gordo's spots over the course of my adult life. Never been too blown away. Always thought their burritos were way too soupy. I have to say the 9th/Irving location has forever changed my mind. 

First of all, the super burrito was HUGE! Filled with so many delicious delights! Refried beans were totally on hit. They were light and everything you would expect from homemade refried beans. I loved the rice! Bright red color, a bit on the salty side, but, hey I like it! The Carnitas was crispy not fatty. SO GOOD!

Only thing I would suggest adding is lettuce and tomato to your menu. When I order a burrito I like some vegetable inside to cut the fatty-ness. 

Gordo's has been added to my master burrito list. Next time I'm craving a burrito I'll be considering YOU!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
I always come in with the intention of getting a carnitas super burrito because I keep hearing how great it is - but somehow I always leave with a grilled chicken super burrito. I can't explain how this happens but it's so on point, I must have it wired in me! The super burrito is the way to go - super filling for about $7 and I usually divide it in half and save some for later to avoid food coma. If you add guac, the total will be about $8.35. All things considered this is not awful for the amount of food you get! 

The super burrito is filled with rice, beans (I usually opt out), salsa, cheese, and your choice in meat. Gordo's is not a bad choice for burritos in the neighborhood - it does the job and the chicken is really good - large chunks, tasty, and very tender. Low key joint, seating is available but I would recommend taking a stroll to Golden Gate Park (not even 5 minutes away) and enjoying there if you can!
author: Deanna S.

description:
Deeply disappointed... I've been going to Gordo's since middle school. Not to age myself, but it's been many years. It has been a while since my last visit, but last Friday I picked up dinner here and was so disappointed with the quality and service. 

I had called in my order and when I got there, my order wasn't ready. This was fine, I had no problem waiting. I ordered a super burrito with boiled chicken. The guy looked at my order like he's never made a burrito in his life. He forgot to put pico de gallo in my burrito, and when I reminded him, half on my burrito was pico de gallo... which made the whole burrito super soggy. I had also asked for the burrito to be grilled. Normally they would grill the burrito before it's wrapped in foil. This guy wrapped the burrito in all the pico de gallo juices and then grilled it. Basically cooking the tortilla in tomato juice. Ugh! My husband ordered a carne asada plate. He said the carne asada was dry. Nothing much to complain, but nothing much to rave about either.  

I never expected Gordo's to on par with El Farolito, but I've always counted on it to be solid comfort food. Not sure what happened, but get it together!
author: Bianca C.

description:
Admittedly I was the last one in the restaurant tonight. But I'm horrified with the quality of the crew.

Two guys trying to make my burrito, laughing while apparently putting too much sour cream on it, we're having a tough time rolling it together. Then the cashier took over preparing my food with his BARE HANDS. He double wraps it in foil then laughs as he said "too much sour cream".

1. If you make a mistake while preparing an order, fix it or remake it. 2. Maybe follow the health code and don't waste my $11.50

Buyer beware
author: Amanda M.

description: Delicious food! A must when in San Francisco. We stopped here on a whim for lunch and we were not disappointed.
author: Terra P.

description:
We went to visit family - we live in Minnesota. I am originally from Mexico City so I always crave good Mexican food and I found it! 
We got something that is not on the menu that is call tostada, they just grill more the tortilla and put cheese then you ask for the rest, we did carnitas w guac, beans, salsa and omg it was heaven! My daughter has the chicken with cheese quesadilla and the way the food taste my daughter wanted to come back again! unfortunately due to timing we could make it again, but definitely we will be back when we are in town to visit.
author: Laura M.

description:
Good food, but sometimes the lines get super long and the staff does not care to help move it along. I'm posting this review from the line. Multiple couples and families have received and finished their meals here and we are still in line. No exaggeration. I've been standing in line for over 40 min. Probably closer to 50 min. If you don't believe me check the picture I posted. The lines out the door and only one person making the food, one cook, and one cashier.

From now on I will call in all my orders........
author: Jay C.

description: One of the best burritos I've had! I got chicken in my tortilla and it was very tasty. They steam the tortilla so it's nice and soft, guac comes with the burrito for no extra charge! Their food is not overly salty and their prices are pretty good (I think $6 for a regular burrito). Def would come back if I'm in the area and def would recommend to friends and family.
author: Bonnie N.

description:
As I'm sure others have mentioned the shops in Albany and Berkeley are better.  This review is specifically for the shop on 9th avenue and not Gordo as a whole.

What's great:

Their meats (and burritos in general). All the meats are tasty.  The chicken is particularly tender.  The carnitas could be crispier, but still have good flavor. It's a tasty burrito all around though. 

Their simplicity. There aren't many choices. Regular has meat, beans, rice, and salsa on a smaller (but not that small) tortilla. Super is the same except add cheese and bigger tortilla.  You can get the same in a "plate" version. Add things like sour cream if you want.

Reasonable prices and decent sized burritos (not the GIANT ones that some places do, but on the generous side)

What's not as great:

The layout of the 9th street store is weird. Where you are supposed to line up to order is unclear and the line does a U shape which is strange. Also, only one person stands at the counter at once which seems inefficient - and a staple of burritos is efficiency.  

You have to buy chips and salsa. Yep. It's a problem.

Sour cream and Guacamole are never included - which is ok - but makes the listed price deceptively cheap (cause really - who doesn't get guacamole and sour cream?).
author: Sarah C.

description:
Gordo is the go-to for burritos if you're not feeling the trek to the Mission district in San Francisco. I have to say, even after coming here for ten years, Gordo has stayed constant with its great prices, decent portion sizes, and overall flavor. 

My recommendation is to go for the super burrito (but the quesadilla is also killer). In it, you get cheese, rice, beans, your choice of meat, and definitely get the hot sauce and salsa. And it's only $7.50. The burrito itself is delicious and wet, and I man literally wet, because I drown my burritos in sauce and salsa. Unfortunately, guacamole and sour cream are extra if that's your thing, and there's no open salsa bar. 

So overall, awesome burrito for the price. It's hard to compare this burrito to El Farolito's, which is another great, great burrito joint in San Francisco, because they do it so differently. However, definitely check this place out if you're in the Sunset or Richmond. You won't be disappointed.
author: Anderson H.

description: This place continues to change my life every time I hit it up. The carnitas super burrito is to die for!  And it's the same staff working there over the years that knows how to do it right. I've been coming here on and off 15 years and never once been disappointed.  Quesadillas are super yummy too!
author: Robert C.

description:
if bland is your thing, here is the place, otherwise, go elsewhere. i had a grilled chicken burrito with pico de gallo and hot sauce. no flavor. when i requested extra pico de gallo, it looked sad and old. no salsa's or hot sauces were available unless you ask. 

i've not been to this place in ages, and now i know why. 
too many other great food options in this neighborhood to bother again. 

adios
author: Wendy X.

description:
I have been craving gordos for a long while now. Since my adolescent years... I've been sucked into going to the mission for their burritos and quesadillas..,while they are great, i feel these days have been lacking. 
My pregnancy cravings kicked in. Today was the day that I re-visit Gordos. and ... it's what I remember. Crispy, tasty, spicy; boiled chicken quesadilla with salsa, guac, sour cream, little rice on a spinach tortilla. Craving Satisfied!
author: PreciousSwt P.

description:
Went there at 6pm, no line today prob the rain
The food is alright, not much customer service
Only one person is working on burrito

Orders a steak super burrito
Taste is alright, normal 
Better than the la Fonda a block away that I had before

About the same price
author: Jasper K.

description: I am not from the neighborhood but I have been going to this place since HS since its close by. I believe or want to say its a family owned place and their burritos are pretty good. I mean you I can't imagine you can go wrong with making a burrito but I like this place! My husband grew up in the Richmond district so we both enjoy coming to this place even if its out of the way. I am a pretty simple person, super burrito w/ everything steak and from time to time I would switch it up and get a quesadilla. They are SUPER quick with your food and you can watch them make it.  I think the only downfall is that they dont have shrimp, which my husband tends to like to add to his burritos but we still love this place! Portions are good, and sauces are great. Prices are higher than before and customer service is good as well. Its a small place but parking is a NIGHTMARE! Its on clement a busy street, and its just really hard sometimes to find parking, and it depends on time and day, but almost everytime  my husband and I can never find parking so we double park and one of us runs in to order and get our food. Generally we dont mind making a long trip to this place as we go to the beach area after to sit an watch the sunset or waves while eating and shortly after our little dog gets a walk. All in all great place easy to find, and their quick not much of a wait.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Love love Love be Gordo's burritos!!! Great place for families. My brother comes here any time he's in SF from Hawaii. Love it!
author: Catherine F.

description:
Stopped by Gordos on 9th tonight thinking it would be quick in and out.  Not sure if they got all new staff there now.  The line was about 12 people deep and only two guys making the meals.  Accually more like one and a half as one of the guys ws trying to fill the on line orders to.   

One thing that I noticed was none of the employees were wearing gloves while preparing the food for people. They would make a burritto and then wipe the conter with a gross looking towel.   

The man at the register was very freindly.  He too was not wearing gloves while handling people food.  He was working the register and handling the money and would then reach into the chip pile with his bare hand to fill the chip orders.  

Think the Health Department may need to stop by and give training on proper food hanlding.   Disappointing.
author: C M.

description:
Sooo...apparently their version of a quesadilla is a single corn tortilla and some meat. 
When I asked what the difference between this and a taco, she said "we don't put cheese on a taco" ‍

Child please...
author: Charlie K.

description:
A follow up to before,  I ate at the Gordos on 9th and Irving and it was as good as i remember when I was young.
So ill give them one more star for now.
author: Dan B.

description: Duuuude. These guys are the slowest and dumbest people in the taqueria business.  Maybe they just don't care. Maybe it's all of it. If they weren't so close to my, I'd go elsewhere. The burritos are pretty good, but you can find better. Not worth the wait.
author: Christopher C.

description: Want a crispy taco? Go somewhere else. These people don't know how to do that. When asked to fix it, just got blank stares. Been coming here and other locations for years and it's never been a problem before.
author: V B.

description: 3 Star food. -1 Star for never providing side salsa when you order delivery not matter how many times you ask.
author: Zab G.

description:
Solid burritos! Very affordable. Service can be slow and the wait can be a bit much. Went recently this week and waited over 25 minutes to order my burrito. It seems they get a lot of online orders and make those first before serving customers in store. So if you are going to order; try ordering online ahead and picking up to save time! 

Delicious chicken! Very moist and their guacamole servings are cheap and generous!
author: Jean Marie C.

description:
I love this restaurant. They have high quality ingredients and everything is fresh and tasty. I like the spinach tortilla and go for the boiled chicken or carnitas. Always solid.

Nut allergy note: In discussions with the staff and owners here, they have mentioned that they do not use any peanuts or tree nuts on the premises and have no nuts in any of the food. We have been eating here for years without issues.
author: Sven S.

description: Excellent Tacos options : carne asada so delicious as well as chicken one ! Good size and the Mexican cuisine flavor is on it ! Try on you won't regret it
author: Francisco L.

description:
I paid 8.00 for a small ass burrito. I only went in because usually there's a line. The last few times I walked by, there was no line. Now I can see why. 

The burrito wasn't good at all. They skimped on the meat, the rice, the beans, everything. 

I guess you have to in order to ensure you serve up a small ass burrito.
author: Chris P.

description: Love, love, love this place. Have been eating here since it opened in 1981. It's my first stop when I get to SF.
author: Jim R.

description: Poor gordo's used to be a great little hole in the wall Bay Area chain. In the 80's and 90's it was wonderful but over the years the mix of surly attitudes and slow indifferent service has really take n its toll on the clientele and a he reputation. The Irving location is local for me but I won't go back anymore.
author: Gordon R.

description:
My go-to place for a boiled chicken burrito! And now they serve horchata. It's about time.

They also have a veggie tofu burrito for those who are interested....
author: Angelica C.

description: Good, filling, quick Mexican food. Lots of food for a great price. Haven't had something I didn't enjoy.
author: Mrk P.

description: Pretty meh for tacos. It'll do in a pinch if you're having a craving, but don't go in expecting amazing food.
author: Aishani P.

description: The first time i went to this place craving carne asada and took a pretty big gamble on a "steak" burrito, knowing that it probably tastes more white people-y.  I've had 3 years of mostly mediocre experiences with SF mexican food and this one was no different. I sent a snapchat to my friends trashing bay area mexican food like a proper LA snob does and didnt go back for a year until last week. When I tried the carnitas. Woah mama. That burrito and I were a match made in heaven. It was super tasty, but I also think that without guacamole it wouldn't have been the same. 2.5 star place, 4 star carnitas and guac.
author: Ben S.

description:
Gordo is sorta like the best of the rest! outside of the Mission district and inside of San Francisco. They are not mind blowing or anything but they are good and hit the spot. My "Go to" burrito place because I am rarely in the mission and they are way better than a lot of other little places that I've tried who often don't even know what they're doing. 

One thing that Gordo does right is adding sour cream without it melting just blending in becoming homogenized with the other ingredients so you're not getting that contrast in flavor but just getting the extra calories, most of the other places that don't know how to do that make that mistake. Those other places often heat the burrito up a second time, melting the sour cream. but not Gordo though. they get an extra star just for that. Plus although not the best burritos I've ever tried, they are still pretty damn good and very cheep too. 

I usually get chicken or carnitas. they have two kinds of chicken here! you can never really go wrong with carnitas though.
author: David A.

description: The food here was great!!! I'm not an SF local and this place was just as great as all the recommendations I heard made it seem. The food was super delicious and the wait wasn't too long. Being from LA I'm not really used to such small spots but it worked out nonetheless.
author: Melissa R.

description: Haters are gonna hate. This place is clean, cheap, healthy and fast. I had no problem with the portion size and I'm a healthy super active vegetarian that can eat a LOT! Highly recommend it!
author: Ania M.

description:
First off, let me start by saying that the food here is amazing. I've been coming here since I was a kid and it is some of the best Mexican food in the city, or at least in my neighborhood. However, I had the worst experience here last Sunday evening. The line was really long but as usual, I waited anyway because I'm used to the line moving along relatively fast. The usual workers here know what they're doing. 

Well, this time, I waited for about an hour because it took literally 5-10 minutes per person ordering. There were 3 unfamiliar faces working that night: one guy making orders (he was going so slow and seriously had no idea what he was doing), a kid (maybe 12 years old) working in the back, and a teenager working the register. Actually, there was a 4th guy but I think he was on his 10-minute break the whole time I was there, just lying with his head down at one of the tables. I saw at least 5 customers leave the line because the wait was so ridiculously long. It was nearly silent inside because the guy making burritos was moving so slowly and the place was so understaffed. The dude also messed up a bunch of orders ahead of me. At one point, I saw him plop a bunch of refried beans onto someone's tortilla with such force that the beans got everywhere. I mean, I eventually got my burrito and it tasted good, but the wait was DEFINITELY not worth it. I was livid.

Has this place changed ownership? Did all the good guys retire? I need answers! If Gordo's wants to stay in business, their staffing problem needs to be handled. This is clearly a management issue, and I would really like to see the place improve because I really don't want to give up my local Mexican joint.
author: Michelle M.

description: Not the best taqueria in SF. Their super burrito is about the same price as other great taquerias in the city but didn't even have sour cream or guac.. just rice,beans,meat, salsa and cheese.. that's what they call a super burrito.  And no salsa bar.. you have to pay extra for everything. The flavor isn't that bad but wish it was cheaper at least.
author: Clara L.

description:
I ordered the Super chicken burrito with mild sauce and black beans.  I encountered a guy with no social skills who wore an Oakland A's hat and was preparing my burrito.  While he was preparing my burrito, he was also talking with the cashier and I was a bit confused at the miscommunication that would arise.  He talked to her, and I thought he was talking to me and I answered.  He, however gave me bad attitude when he said he was talking with her.  He should have focused on making a decent burrito.  I ordered mild sauce, but the guy actually gave me hot sauce and it was still stinging my mouth after I finished my meal.  The burrito, overall, wasn't satisfying and I could recommend better taquerias in San Francisco.

I don't recommend this place, especially when there are a lot of options around the neighborhood.
author: Chan L.

description:
Came here last month for 2 regulars + 1 super.  Then came the bill: almost 10 bucks each.  What the feck?  Then I found out the reason was because when I was ordering, the guy that was making the burrs for me would asked "super?", I said no for the 2 and just yes for the 3rd one.  But, the cashier guy probably thought all were super since the guy that made the burrs did not said anything to the cashier.  I was right there and did not see any exchange between them, so that was y almost the 30 bucks I spent.  I was hurrying back to my car since I was parking in a business' driveway, then while in car, it hit me that I got overcharged.  What the feck, I mumbled.

The burritos were ok, not bad.  Just make sure not to get overcharged like me, people.

Should I come back?  Again, lemme try many other spots in the City 1st :).  Or, unless my co-worker pressed me on wanting to eat here again.  Otherwise, feck this spot :).
author: Cu K.

description: Is Gordos under new management ? (Geary Blvd and surrounding Golden Gate Park area). Where are All the employees who have been making my lunch and dinner for years ?? Bad move Gordos!! And my friend said your quesadillas aren't good ; like they used to be too.  Ps.  And I don't think an employee needs to be standing on the grill at dinner time; wiping down a wall that is already spotless.  It seems like you are trying too hard!!
author: Janet J.

description: The three times that i have given this place a shot ( all different locations) but twice here on 9th i have gotten food posioning. I WILL NEVER EAT THERE AGAIN, NO MATTER THE LOCATION
author: Noone I.

description:
I ordered a shredded chicken quesadilla with sour cream & hot sauce . I received a grilled chicken quesadilla . It was a 10in flour tortilla. With half a piece of mozzarella cheese... The chicken regardless was flavorless as well as the hot sauce . You couldn't taste the cheese (there was only half a slice added). Once I paid $10.00 he gave me my quesadilla. I proceeded to sit down & enjoy . The moment i unwrapped it out of its two layers of tin foil. Was the moment I realized it was going to be a disaster. Anyways it was wrapped as if it was a burrito instantly went in for a bite and about 1/4 cup of chicken broth dripped onto the foil. At this point it was still dripping down and I thought I would hold it up so it can continue. At this time I've eaten about four bites trying to give it a chance. It was completely soggy and falling apart. * still dripping broth* I asked for a new quesadilla with no broth and more cheese added & they responded with 'you have to pay for a new one ' . This has been my second time eating at Gordo's and I don't recommend on returning. 

* cons you pay for every condiment you want , $.65sour cream. $.50 for hot sauce etc . It adds up faster than you think.
author: Kayena G.

description:
I only ended up at this place because the Taco Shop at Underdogs didn't allow any outside drinks to be brought inside (we bought tpumps before) and I was craving tacos on Taco Tuesday. It took my friends and I 15 minutes to find parking nearby and was about a 5 minute walk to the taqueria. 

SETTING: A dinky little taqueria that doesn't have anything too fancy about it. 

SERVICE: Not much customer-server interaction as with any other taco joint. Service could be better. The servers are a little unenthusiastic and it's hard to communicate with them because it's so loud inside. 

FOOD: I ended up getting a carne asada taco ($2.75) in a corn tortilla shell with additional toppings including salsa, cilantro, beans, cheese, and sour cream. They charge extra for toppings. It totaled up to about $4.60, which I found ridiculous for such a mediocre taco especially on Taco Tuesday. I expected to get shredded cheese but they just gave me a slice of cheese like what?? I found the taco extremely difficult to eat because my taco fell apart the instant I tried eating it. I just ate it with a fork and knife in the end. The taco was very soggy. There was nothing too special about the carne asada except that it was extremely salty, and didn't amaze me. My taco cravings were not satisfied. 

This place doesn't have any taco tuesday discounts so I don't recommend coming here if you're lookin for some cheap eats. It also doesn't offer free chips and salsa, which I find at other locations. Wouldn't come here again- there's more places you could get better tacos for at a cheaper price in SF.
author: Anne P.

description: Chipotle has BETTER customer service than this place. I went in specifically for Chile verde burrito. In the middle of making my burrito the guy stops to have a conversation for 3 minutes with a person who walked through the front door. Once he was done conversing proceeds to put chicken on my burrito when I specifically asked for Chile verde! Pay more attention to your customers, especially if you want your customers to tip!
author: Ashley F.

description:
I ordered the all meat super burrito. For a super burrito, it was small. At least, the burrito that I got.

What made me rate this place one star was because of the contents of the burrito. The meat inside was very dry and was not worth my money. I tried liking it by taking a couple of more bites, but I just couldn't take it. The meat was also hard to swallow. That's how dry it was.

I wouldn't come back here again...
author: Aj C.

description:
Overrated, I'm disappointed..  I took a burrito all meat. For less than $10, pretty good deal. One of the positive things is that they prepare it pretty fast. The meat is not that good (dry actually), for an all meat the burrito is pretty small, my favorite taqueria is Oaxaquena in Mission and you can feel a HUGE difference. 

I don't like to compare but for a cheaper price you have a bigger burrito + chips and sauces, Gordo charges you $1.65 for that. Plus all the tables were dirty, I went there around 11:30AM I cannot understand that the tables are already filthy, yes at 11:30AM

Concerning the staff : By the way, I speak spanish, so when you speak about other clients (not especially me) in spanish, that's totally unrespectful, not correct at all. The staff operates without gloves, touching food and cleaning the place in the same time.
author: Lino M.

description:
Just hit up this new spot. It's cool. They do a burrito justice. It's funny though that they assume you don't know spanish when you look a different way. It's cool though, I guess. The burrito I ordered was on point. They would have gotten 5 if they had 2 things. 1) chips to accompany my burrito, FOR REALZ! Where the neck are my chips folks. Secondly, the parking is not convenient. If there was at least a lot somewhere. Give and take. Overall, good. I especially enjoy the jalapenos. Bomb diggity all day. 

la comida es deliciosa. no ser un extraño y llegar hasta aquí. Voy a visitar el baño después.
author: Robert F.

description:
I don't understand why these people can't adequately staff their business on weekends. Afternoon on a Sunday, the line is several people deep, and they have overworked dude preparing the food.
Ridiculous! Not everyone is running through the tulips and sipping wine on a Sunday. Some people have limited time during their lunch break and don't have 30 minutes to waste waiting in line for a so-so burrito.
And why do they immediately suggest boring, lame, flavorless pinto beans? F**k pinto beans. And they raise the price on this s**t?
author: Jerry C.

description: Whats up, honestly I been here twice but at different locations and so far I've tried the best burrito in the whole  Bay Area, the beef, the chicken and the carnitas are BOMB! There are so tasty and juicy, I am 100% mexican(Tijuana)  and honestly u can taste the authenticity of real mexican food. This places rocks
author: Jimmy G.

description:
This place used to be great when watching a game at Yancys and grab a rito. Unfortunately the service is absolutely atrocious. Apparently they only hire gangsters who would rather hit on ur girl in line rather than get the order correct. 

Don't eat here, they will hopefully be out of business before they ruin anyone else's experience.
author: Carlos A.

description: I would agree, place has gone down hill. Prices are higher now (10.00 per super burrito with guac and sour cream added. Refried beans taste canned. Good meat ingredients- good quality control but some of the clerks appear to be on cruse control. They have a real hangup about offending people by not offering a really hot salsa- either mild or slightly hot. Never understood that. It used to be a great deal but now kind of like many SF Mexican joints, not big portions, not that great and expensive. Would go back but highly disappointed.
author: Kay C.

description:
I came here once before my Yelp years, so I'm glad I got to officially try Gordo Taqueria more recently and write the review that it deserves. I was at trivia night around the block at Blackthorn and hadn't eaten yet. Gordo seemed like the right choice for late night dinner... Mexican food pairs well with beer and trivia.

I ordered the carnitas plate and OMG I cannot get over how good the carnitas is!! Best carnitas I've had in the Bay Area, I would say. The plate is piled high with food, and they stuff their burritos to the max. The guys who work here have way too much fun, but the menu is straightforward, there is plenty of seating, and I love the experience overall. I'm prepared to begin craving this specific place soon!
author: Stefanie C.

description: I am a long time Gordo's customer. Their food is mostly very good, but they really need to think about what they are doing when preparing a burrito. If you order anything that is in fluids, like boiled chicken, they slop the chicken plus all the water into your burrito. How can they not know that that burrito will become a soggy mess? Strain the fluids before slopping them into a burrito.
author: Warren S.

description:
I

The Gordo's on clement es mejor bueno.  came here because i had to get Gordo before i hit the road. sure wish i didn't. they didn't know what i usually order, which is basically a burrito but the tortilla is a quesadilla, i know i'm a fatty, but heck it's good. this place just wasn't the same.
author: Arnold W.

description: honestly the best burrito in town. Boiled chicken with pinto beans and spicy tomatoes (and everything else) is absolutely freakin bomb. The one in the Richmond is good- the one in the sunset is better (not the one on Irving). Also -- their guac is great too.
author: Noreen C.

description:
Gordo's is still one of my favorites
In the neighborhood.  There are not a lot of burrito places in the Sunset Dist aside from Burrito Express on Taraval.  

We had just finished a visit to the Academy of Sciences or known to locals who grew up here as the Steinhart Aquarium when we were tots. Gordo's was on the way home. Hubby does his usual Jedi mind trick on me,  "I feel like having a burrito". Normally I resist such trickery and counter with "No, I want...."  But I haven't had my fav carnitas burrito from Gordo's in a while. 

Hubby ordered 2 carnitas and added dollops of extra sour cream. We prefer the black beans over the pintos. The burritos looked smaller.  Normally I can only consume 1/2 to 3/4 of one but I ate the entire thing.  I also like the quesadilla with only cheese which comes out crispy from the grill with yummy melted cheese.  I am glad Gordo's is still here after all these years because there are a lot of food choices on 9th Ave now compared to when I lived in the hood decades ago.
author: Ry T.

description:
I'm pretty confused by those who say this is the best burrito outside the Mission. Maybe in terms of price, things are reasonable (about $7 for a super burrito, without avocado or sour cream....but who doesn't get those...). However, in terms of flavor, Gordo is kind of lacking. The mexican rice tastes incredibly bland (not like Mexican rice, but more like rice that had a tiny spoonful of Mexican seasoning in it), the beans are flavorless (Chipotle has more flavorful beans), and the carnitas that I got were not crispy nor salty, and weren't a great complement to the rice, cheese, and beans. I don't like sour cream, so I didn't get it; the guac portions are tiny (three slaps of a tiny rectangular spatula) and kind of disappear into the burrito. All in all, the price is cheap, but the value isn't great.

...especially when the person who made my burrito didn't wash his hands OR use gloves. Additionally, while waiting for my tortilla to heat, he chopped my carnitas...on the dirty countertop (as opposed to the cutting board where he prepares the tortilla). Same guy as everyone else has been getting - a dude wearing an Oakland A's hat who doesn't gel socially well with you. The point is, you get a cheap, bland burrito, with nearly no service and no cleaniness. Which means, it'll do in a jiffy, but I wouldn't return often.
author: Bobby W.

description: I've been going to Gordos for nearly 2 decades. This is my favorite spot in the city and I've never been let down. Fantastic!
author: Katherine C.

description: I'm confused about all the reviews talking about the delicious, quality ingredients, but my wife and I will not be back. Perhaps we've been spoiled by Papalote (our regular spot), but we each got burritos at Gordo's and found them to be virtually flavorless. I got a carne asada burrito and had several chunks of gristle that I couldn't even chew through. Neither of us finished our meals and neither of us felt great after eating them. As they're only open until 9, I can't even recommend it as a late night desperation meal.
author: Mark B.

description: Worst service ever. I never leave reviews but had to for this. I only come here because its the closes taqueria near me. Staff always has a bunch of attitude and are VERY rude. My last straw was tonight when I called in and ordered a burrito to go. The women on the phone was super unprofessional and said it would be a 35-40 minute wait for pick up which I thought was ridiculous but I really didn't mind. Waited all that time to come in and have them forget my order and not even apologize for it, the best part is they had ran out of most of their ingredients so they couldn't even make it up. Ended walking out with nothing. I came here a lot but will NEVER come here again. Would have given 0 stars if that was an option. Nothing beats a SoCal burritos and that's the truth.
author: Aaron B.

description: Customer service is non-existence at this location. The cashier, the girl with the tattoo on her hand didn't even apologize when she handed some change to me when she dropped all the change all over the counter. I told her she could put the change in her tips jar. That's all she deserved! Never greeted me,but noticed she greeted the guy who was in front of me who was just their for some change. How odd! And here I was a paying customer; was being treated rudely. Gordo - you can do better hiring someone who is more people-person and actually has skills in customer service. Obviously this girl somehow has some personal thing against paying-customers who are women.i ordered Gordo plate chicken and she was confused when I told her I wanted to order chips and salsa. She kept asking me with hand gesture; as is I wanted a small salsa? Now she was making me confused. This isn't the first time I ordered chips and salsa and it is on the bloody menu. I don't understand why she was confused. It's simple chips and salsa as a side order. I don't get it.
author: Jas L.

description:
I've been here a few times and it's always been kind of... ok. Not too bad but not special either. Decided to give it another try. The person who answered the phone was very unenthusiastic. I ordered a super chicken burrito and typically people ask what beans or other ingredients you would like. Nope, not him. I got silence. Then as I awkwardly waited for an answer, I said "... with black beans". All I got was "uh huh." There were a few more "uh huhs" before my order was complete. 

I went to go pick up the food 15 minutes later. As I approached the cash register, I saw my order on the counter waiting for me. The cashier handed me the bag and I noticed the bottom of the bag was soaking wet with pico de gallo juice. The aluminum foil from the food was also tearing through the bottom of the drenched bag. I asked if I could get another bag and showed him the damage of the original one. He says "That's 10 cents". Seriously? You handed me my order with a bag that is dripping with juice and about to tear open and you're going to charge me for your mistake? I was frustrated but decided to give him the 10 cents.

When I got back I grabbed the food from the bag and immediately regretted ordering Gordos. My food was luke warm at best and just soggy. It was difficult to finish but I was starving. I don't think I will be coming back again.
author: robin w.

description: Not the best burrito I had. It's ok for the price. Nice and friendly people working in the place. Its clean and well organized. Will definitely recommend it if you're on a limited budget.
author: Saurav S.

description: Wish I could give this a minus 10. Got 2 regular burrito and it turn out to be snack size burritos from frozen section probably. Well frozen burrito taste better than this. Our chili verde had 4 tiny miniature dry pork meat and I mean dried pork. Imaginary green sauce. Tasteless small burrito. Never again  extremely poor quality burrito. Extremely cheap on ingredients, no flavor whatsoever. Don't waste your money here.
author: Wolfie M.

description: I have been to Gordo's in SF many times. Today I went with my friend Karl who says he really likes Gordo's and eats here a lot. I had a chicken burrito and it was just okay. It was kind of sloppy and messy. I like to have a burrito with the right stature and control so that it's not spilling everywhere and ending up in my nose. I also decided to try their chicken quesadilla. They put a thin slab of white cheese on a medium flour tortilla. They added chicken and pico. It was just like a burrito. It was edible, but not incredible. That's my motto for average. The food is always edible at Gordo's, but it is not the most stellar experience. Somewhat cheap food.
author: Denise C.

description:
Great food , ok service .  
No matter what I given 5 starts. Best burritos in town. If there were nicer maybe my wife would like to go more often.
author: Edgardo S.

description: Always delicious and amazing service! Can't beat the prices. Quesadilla is the best order and tacos are substantial. No frills place but ingredients are quality and their carnitas are some of the best in town!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
A good spot for taco's and burritos.  Service was fast but the cashier could have at least smiled or give off a more friendly vibe.  I guess  I wouldn't be happy if I had to work on a gorgeous Sunday.

The tacos are huge and loaded with ample meat.  Its served with beans and salsa inside the taco.

Seating can be tough when its busy but a solid spot for good Mexican food.
author: Henry S.

description: I been going there for 15yrs.  Hasn't changed really and that's a good thing, but I haven't been there this year.   One of the few places I go for a good whopping burrito.  I tend to go there at off hours, so I never wait in line.
author: tom c.

description: Super underrated of the Mexican places in SF. I live two blocks away and my gym is right next door, so I know this place real well. I get the Gordo plate, which is just meat, rice, beans, sour cream, guac, salsa and hot sauce (no cheese, tortillas optional). It all looks good, though. Carnitas and beef are especially great. The best part is that about this place is that it's cheap. You can get a filling meal for $10 or less. Keeps me coming back.
author: Dylan D.

description:
Came here after going to the Academy of Sciences and it was relatively full when we arrived. 
The "cashier" was completely rude from the moment we arrived, until the moment we left. Not only did he stand at the counter rudely shouting orders at people the entire time, his way at speaking with customer lacked professionalism. 
I understand you want to leave early, but we are paying customers and this behavior is inexcusable.
author: Andrea G.

description:
Pros: Fast, Generally good

Cons: Customer service & Attitude!

We (Those who live in the Richmond & Sunset Districts), are faced with very low-tier quality taqueria options. Gordo is one of those options! You need to really be vigilant if you eat here. They will skimp, charge you more or do whatever it takes to maximize their profit.

Go for the "All Meat" burrito and make sure they do not screw you over. It can be a task but keep focused and speak up. Common deception is they will pour on liquid but not the actual meat. That happened couple times. Surprised they don't notice me or maybe they just don't care.
author: Nathan A.

description: I've been coming here for over 2 decades and I don't plan to stop. Every time I crave a burrito this place hits the spot
author: Jasmin R.

description:
Came to eat here with the fam.

Its one of the best burrito places that ive been to.
author: Vicente A.

description: Average food. I do like the whole bean and cheese burritos. The guacamole seemed tasteless. The chicken is better than the asada.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Love this place. I had a burrito from here almost 4 years ago and have been dreaming ab out it ever since.   I finally had the chance to have another one about 4 days ago when I was visiting the bay area.   Quality is still great to me despite the naysayers. Prices are right and they employees are nice .

I LOVE LOVE LOVE how they melt the cheese on the tortilla before adding the rest of whatever you want.  The original "quesorito".


I wish I had another one right now. Dang.

One of the best half chicken half steak extra cheese black bean rice sour cream burritos I've ever had.lol

Fun fact the founder of Chipotle started his famous chain after living in SF in the 80s and being inspired by establishments like this joint. 

 But the thing is chipotle doesn't even come close.
author: Aerin A.

description:
Although usually good and used to be a spot for a cheap and fast burrito, after going today I am disappointed. I remember coming here to get a hefty size burrito that usually left me stuffed. Today however, was not the case. 

No, today I was given a burrito that resembled an appetizer. Congratulations, you guys just lost a customer.  Raise the price a little if you're hurting financially but don't cut the size of my burrito.
author: Travis L.

description: Portions are huge but the flavor isn't good. I guess that's what you get when you get taqueria style food in the Avenues.
author: Robynn J.

description:
This place sucks and the staff is rude as hell. The food is okay but nothing amazing. We only came here because it was the only place close by for Mexican. If I knew that the staff was going to be so rude I would of just went down to the mission district. The whole staff was rude and mean to every single person that walked into the restaurant. To top it off when I was waiting to take my order the cashier was talking shit about the customers in Spanish not knowing that I understand every single word they were saying. When they where taking my order the guy with the ponytail was being rude and didn't give two shits about my order. 

***** do not eat here this place isn't worth it at all. You want good food and a good staff eat somewhere else that's far far away from this place.******

Ps. I'm sad to write all this and talk this way about other Latinos but these ASSHOLES give Latinos a bad name.
author: Antonio C.

description: Good, basic burritos - there's nothing fancy about this place. Line typically moves quickly since the menu is small but I have to agree about the service. There's nothing personable about the service and the restaurant is usually unkept. I take mine to-go but I'm hoping for an alternative spot to open in the neighborhood.
author: Shannon D.

description: I always heard about how great this place was... then I went here. Price wise pretty cheap/normal, flavor wise eh, they put a long slice of pepper jack cheese which confused me?? thankfully I ate then visited the rest room. It looks like thy have a fruit fly infestation I almost threw up after we left. Wouldn't visit again.
author: Jackie H.

description:
The customer service is horrible, but the food is cheap and delicious! The chile verde is super flavorful and tender. The "regular" burrito size was the perfect portion for me - I can feel a burrito coma coming on, but I'm not painfully stuffed =)

I will probably try other taco/burrito shops in the area before coming back, just to see if there is somewhere with better service that has comparable food and prices.
author: Haley M.

description: Super affordable burritos for about 6 bucks! Filled me right up, perfect for takinng to eat in the park.  Tasty too!
author: Christopher O.

description:
My friends and decided to try out Gordo Taqueria since it was close by the California Academy of Sciences.  They didn't do anything wrong, but there also was nothing in particular that stood out from any other taqueria that I have been too.  

Food was served quickly and the portions were generous.
author: Alissa Y.

description: Once the most legendary burrito in SF, consistent with its name, Gordo's is now a big, fat disappointment.  From one visit to the next, you can have life changing carnitas, or find yourself tossing an inedible burrito or taco into the trash after a bite or two.  It pains me to write these words.  Like so many SF locals, Gordo's was a major food group growing up here.  In fact, Gordo's was so special that two Bay Area natives actually attempted to make an exact replica in New York to satisfy their craving (http://www.nytimes.com/2010/01/06/dining/reviews/06unde.html).  Now, Gordo's former magic is all but gone.  The previously perfectly-crisp-yet-chewy-on-the-inside carnitas that exploded with flavor and spice is now just salty and overcooked, unless it's soggy and flavorless.  The O.G. Gordo's with the friendly Giants-loving burritistas and four-item menu, now slaps together a sautéed "veggie medley" on spinach "wraps" with the care and enthusiasm of a high school cafeteria.  On my last visit (probably literally my last visit), I had to toss a carnitas quesadilla that was wrapped in soggy dough soaked all the way through with uncooked vegetable oil.  Couldn't even touch it let alone muster a bite.  Gordo's has all the key ingredients to mount a comeback--it just needs ownership that actually wants to live up to its once-storied reputation.
author: Ronald C.

description:
I can't get over how different Mexican food can be between SF and LA.  This place is a good example.

Nice little taqueria here, right off the 9th ave entrance to golden gate park.  Not too crowded but a lot of business here and for good reason.  Good cheap eats!

Doesn't really matter what you order here: taco, burrito or quesadilla, it's all the same just in different form.  Pick your ingredients, they're all tasty here!

I got a bean and cheese taco with black beans, rice, salsa, guac and sour cream for just under $3.  This thing was huge!  Rice and beans were fantastic, cheese melted just right, and double wrapped corn tortilla did not fall apart.  

Also got a grilled chicken quesadilla.  Again stuffed full of chicken, cheese, salsa.  Only got one corn tortilla and this did not hold up very well.  Fell apart quickly.  But the grilled chicken was astoundingly good.  Had to dig around in the wrapper to pick up all the savory pieces that fell out after my tortilla fell apart.  

Good place if you want a quick bite without spending much!
author: Gino I.

description: Carnitas burrito is my favorite burrito in San Francisco, hands down. I will always have a place in my heart (and tummy) for Gordo's!!
author: Lizzy R.

description:
These guys have set the bar high on my burrito. Their grilled chicken is always my favorite, it is miles above the boiled chicken you find at a lot of places (but they also have that if you like it for whatever reason).

Not a whole lot of seating, but usually get it to go so its never been an issue for me.
author: Dyl B.

description:
If I could give this place zero stars I would. 

1. The employees are extremely rude (having side conversations while waiting on customers and making the customers wait til they were through talking to finish waiting on them). 

2. The guy making the burrito used his bare hands! (I knew I should have just left then!) 

3. You have to make sure to answer their questions in the way they want the answers, meaning the guy said "sour cream, guacamole" I said "No sour cream" meaning no sour cream yes guacamole. He put a huge heap of sour cream on my burrito. I absolutely hate sour cream and I said "I wanted no sour cream". He let out a big sigh and threw the burrito into the trash very dramatically. WTF?!? 

4. Then they charged me for both! I was so pissed about the guys crappy attitude that all I wanted to do was get out of there ASAP and not deal with them anymore so I didn't realize til after I paid and left. 

5. The food is bland and sub par at best. My burrito was watery from the worker slopping beans and bean water into it instead of taking a moment to let a bit of water drain out. 

Don't go here unless you like rude service, food prepared with strangers bare hands, and below average food.
author: Sylvia D.

description: Man, I really wanted to love Gordo's, but an establishment that is relatively dirty and has ants crawling around the soda machine gets a 1 star in my book. I came here on the whim because I was in the area and wanted something quick and cheap. Immediately upon entering, I was greeted with friendly smiles and placed an order for a carne asada quesadilla with light sour cream. If requested, the quesadilla came with tomatoes, sour cream, and guacamole. Everything was fine until I headed over to the soda machine and saw ants crawling from the corner - definitely gross! As soon as I opened my quesadilla, I noticed that it was dripping with the tomato juices, which kind of turned me off, but I thought the quesadilla was pretty good despite the unauthentic addition of tomatoes. Probably won't be back!
author: Joyce E.

description:
I am so sad.  I have been going here for 30 years.  They used to be the best and I always knew the quality was declining, but...

There are no good burrito places in the Sunset except this one, for decades, and now they give garbage.  I never had to spit such dry burned carnitas out my door window in my life.  I had to throw the quesadilla in the garbage; I have never done that before for any food... small portion, extremely poor quality (I know what they used to be; great) overpriced now.  I am so sad.

Well, now I will just go to the Mission now to get good burritos; they have the best.  Or Chinos on Balboa 32nd ave; they are still totally legit...  La Carneta has huge portions and are fantastic...  The Mission, well...  pick one; you cannot go wrong.

But I am so sad that the decline of El Gordo has finally reached its zenith.  Well, I still have the memories of the days of yore when they were the best, and somehow they are the worst now.

It boggles my mind.
author: Timotheus C.

description:
One of the more authentic Mexican restaurant in the Sunset area. I usually order a chile verde with pinto and sour cream. Pretty bomb restaurant, glad it is nearby.

Pro
Authentic Mexican food
local
inexpensive

Con
Size of burrito is inconsistent.
line
author: Ricky C.

description:
Gordo's is my favorite Taqueria. Go ahead, tar and feather me.

Now that that's over, let me explain why. Yes, I love my super suiza from El Farolito and my tacos from Vallarta. But for some reason, the super burrito from Gordo's is my go-to meal. As a San Francisco Native, I was born and raised on Gordo's burritos. Maybe that's why I feel such a connection with the place, but I'd like to think it's more factual than sentimental.

The meats I order in my super burrito are seasonal. Don't ask me why, because I can't really explain. Fall is steak, Winter is carnitas, Spring is grilled chicken, and Summer is whatever my hangover feels like on that given day. The combo of Guac, Sour Cream, Tomatoes, and Hot Sauce is what dreams are made of. If you're bold, please get jalapeños as well.

I only come to the 9th and Irving location because they have the best service. My burrito is always rolled with extra love, and extra foil. People will always hate on Gordo's, and I get it, but if you're in the area or need a pick me up, please look no further.

Bonus: Their fountain coke is CRACK. Best fountain coke in the city.
author: Kevin K.

description: The burrito vegetariano was just ok. The service was bloody awful!!! The gorda lady working the cash register was beyond rude and I tipped her. Never again Gordo Taqueria.
author: Adam H.

description: Ordered a Super Carnitas Burrito but got home and no sour cream.  Just a regular burrito.  That sucked a bit.  The guac was good but really put in a really small container.
author: Shaun C.

description:
I came here for lunch and there was a long line. I always order the super grilled chicken burrito with guacamole, sour cream, and hot sauce. The burrito is pretty big and it tastes great. 

There are a lot of small tables with small bench seats. Service is pretty fast. They make everything in front of you.
author: Alexander L.

description: Gordo used to be awesome and affordable-- since the 90's--- Now the food is stale and it just sucks.  The food preparers don't wear gloves and they touch your food after scratching their bellies ad wiping their faces.  I'm grossed out now. For the first time tonight I actually returned my quesadilla.  It was horrible. The food was stale (hard rice, old tortilla etc. ) yet I paid more than ever before.  They raised their prices a few months ago apparently.  RIP Gordo on 9th and Lincoln.  We had a great run-- no more.  Stale globs of mediocre.  So sad but true.  The Sunset is in desperate need of a good, quality taqueria!!! Please!  San Francisco lives off burritos!!  WTF.
author: Niki G.

description:
Burrito in tummy = good.

If I'm ever in town and crave me a burrito, this is the place to be.  However, it's inconsistent... I only say inconsistent because there are times when my burrito just looks itty-bitty... not what I was expecting, and then times when it's made to perfection.  I go for the usual: Super Burrito - spicy and carnitas. YUMMMM...  You gotta eat it while it's hot though... or else it gets super dry since the rice absorbs back all the juices.  I'd love to take home a pint of that salsa next time. ;)
author: Julie C.

description: First time I went here I had a vegi burrito and was not impressed (very tasteless).  The restaurant was closing in 20 minutes but they made it obvious that they wanted to close NOW.  Second time I went to Gordo, there where a few people milling around and it was not clear as to  where to place order, so went to the register, was told to go over to the counter then told I needed to "go back there and order"  WTF?  I walked out at that point.  0 customer service.
author: John C.

description:
GROSS!  This place needs to be shut down by the health department!  The waiters here handle everything in your food with their bare hands, and the food isn't even that good.  The waiters have attitude problems- one time I asked the waiter to put gloves on and he pretended not to understand English.  I told him to put gloves on in Spanish, and he told me they don't have gloves.  WHAT?  You don't have gloves?  There's no way a restaurant can operate without gloves!!
Then the cashier told me with sass that the San Francisco Health Department doesn't require servers to wear gloves, lol!  I found that very hard to believe.

After insisting that the waiter wear gloves, he pulled out a box from the back room and put together my burrito.  Although I shouldn't have eaten there, I ordered a carnitas burrito, and the guy just slapped together all of the ingredients and half-heartedly rolled up the burrito.  When I was eating the burrito, I almost choked on the sharpness of the meat because it was sooo dry.  

Never coming back here again!
author: Sarah L.

description:
I rarely write reviews, but my terrible experience at Gordo Taqueria warrants one.

I ordered a Super Beef Burrito. It was bland to say the least. Not much too it. Rice, beans, beef, tomatoes, and a slice of melted cheese. There is no flavor. The beef is chewy and not cooked well. The only positive thing to say about the burrito is that it is a healthy portion and it is cheap ($6.35). If I was judging my experience based on the burrito alone, I would probably give it two stars.

But the service was atrocious. After my burrito was prepared, I go to pay and the guy working the cash register tells me it's $7.33 (or something). He didn't ask if I wanted a drink or chips or anything. I ask if I can please have chips and salsa, plus a water. He looks super annoyed because now he has to ring it up again. Whatever. He grabs me everything and I pay him. My burrito, chips, salsa, and drink are still on the table. I ask him if I can get a bag. He rolls his eyes, sighs, and tells me that it will be $0.10. What planet am I on? It's only $0.10, that is not why I am complaining. It's the fact that they charge for a brown paper bag and the attitude I was getting for simply asking for one. Having already paid, I declined and had to carry everything out.

I don't know if what I've written has done my experience any justice. I am sure people will read this and think I am complaining about nothing. But again, I felt obliged to write this review. Honestly, I almost asked for my money back, but I figured I would at lease give the food a try. I moved to SF last week and live two streets over. I will never go back.
author: Thomas N.

description: Good location close to Golden Gate park. Bland food. Got 2 burritos and rice and beans - I'd say below average in taste. Even the coke in their soda machine was flat. Limited menu (e.g. No nachos, salads). Unless you are going there out of convenience (e.g. Having a picnic in the park), you can do a lot better for Mexican food in San Francisco.
author: Rick P.

description: Have you ever felt you're being an inconvenience to the cashier?  Then you wonder if the food is as good as their service?  Well, the food was okay, but 75% than the service. If you choose to go there hope you have a better experience with the service
author: Delna F.

description:
I usually like Gordos...it's simple, tasty, and inexpensive. Though I usually frequent the location on Geary, I've stopped by this one a few times too. It's just this location I don't like....it's not their fault but there are so many creepy people sitting right outside. And it smells like urine and there are pet feces right outside the door. They restroom is as clean as a gas stations'

I know it's not their fault, but just letting the world know. Go to the location on Geary...it's much cleaner :D
author: Wanda M.

description: Ordered takeout and specified that I can't have cheese. They assured me not a problem in their regular burritos, but sure enough, my vegi burrito was full of cheese.  Anyone with a dietary restriction should avoid the establishment.
author: Esteban M.

description:
I've been going to Gordo on 9th Ave for literally 25 years. I've always liked their food and have never ever gotten sick. The quality is not amazing but it's consistent, hot, their super burritos are gigantic, I like their guacamole and their green salsa is awesome. I would have rated it 5 stars, but...

The new cashier they've had working for the last few months is the biggest a-hole I've ever encountered working in any restaurant. Ever. Yes, it's the same guy everyone else is complaining about: jailhouse tats, extreme attitude, watching TV when there's a line of people waiting to pay. Try asking him for some extra salsa, or thanking him, or conversing with him in any way at all -- you might as well have just asked him for the keys to his mom's apartment based on his typical reaction.

Owners of Gordo, pay attention: you are losing customers because of this jerk. I refuse to patronize this taqueria as long as he is working here. Get rid of him unless you want your business to continue to suffer and maybe go down the drain entirely.
author: Jay B.

description:
I really can't believe I've never reviewed Gordo's before. I swear I've been here many times when I lived in the neighborhood. 

Favorite things to get:
- quesadilla: They make it pretty quickly and you can add some guacamole and salsa to it as well. 
-super burrito: beans, meat, rice, guac, sour cream, salsa - everything you can ask for in a burrito and it's a pretty big one. I rarely ever finish one and when I do, I tend to not want do anything for the rest of the day. 

Overall, great place, nice guys and decent service. They don't have any frills, but it's great because of that.

Protip: if you don't want beans and rice, a cheaper way to get a "burrito" is to get the quesadilla with everything in it. Delicious, but a bit messy to eat.
author: Nina Y.

description:
I wish there was a gordo's closer to my house. 

The meat hasn't changed - always good and juicy. They are always fast and efficient with getting you your food, don't complain what you request a late add, and always seem friendly. 

Definitely a keeper!
author: Jon H.

description:
I normally don't like to share a negative review about a restaurant. I prefer to email them directly but since I can't find a website, I will post my thoughts here.

I just ordered burritos through Postmates from Gordo's. They are out go-to spot for a decent burrito in the neighborhood. It was a disaster.  I blame Postmates for their incompetent ordering, I ordered an ALL MEAT burrito. For any one that lives in SF that means a tortilla, meat and any add extras. NO rice. NO beans. ONE type of meat. What do I get???? ALL types of meat in a burrito??? Chicken, beef AND pork. All in one burrito. WTF? Seriously? It's not all TYPES of meat. It's simply ALL meat.

So that was a major fail.

And the other burritos had maybe 3 pieces of meat per side. Filled with rice and beans. No guac or sour cream or cheese... Even though I ordered a super burrito.

These "convenience" services don't know how to properly partner with their vendors and customers for a good order. And shame on Gordo's for their inferior product on a to-go order for a loyal customer.

I'm beyond disappointed in both parties. This is not the same product I would have received if I would have ordered in person... Or so I hope.

I should have gone to the Mission.
author: Kathy G.

description:
If you're planning on dining in, make sure you wear your long johns, parka, hat & a scarf. They always leave the door open and I freeze my ass off. If you're a penguin, maybe  you like that. 
The carnitas were awful today. Dry and chewy. The Geary location is way better and I'll be going there from now on.
author: Sophia C.

description: My #1 spot for amazeballs burritos in our neighborhood.  The carnitas are FANTASTIC, and I highly recommend getting the All Meat Super Burrito if you're hangry......absolutely PHENOMENAL!111  Also, get a couple of the red sauces to go.
author: Paul M.

description:
Ingredients/prices are okay and I haven't experienced mean service, but why don't these guys take more care in wrapping burritos? A lot of the time they don't wrap the tortilla properly and ingredients are falling out and they don't even do anything to fix this. It makes me crazy. I avoid going here even though it's convenient, because I know the burrito will fall apart while I eat it.

I also would never eat here because the seats are very uncomfortable but maybe that's just me.
author: Amanda V.

description: Decent taqueria/burrito spot. Nothing over the top special, but they're usually pretty quick and the prices are decent enough.
author: Luis M.

description: This place is delicious. Definitely the food that keeps them in business because customer service is not the best.
author: Sarah A.

description:
High School Nostalgia Series. Now, "gordo" means "fat" en espanol, so you KNOW they're gonna have gigantic portions!

I was a starving teenager in high school. I guess I still am, minus the teenager part. This was my one-stop shop for filling UP. Burritos are huuuge and loaded. My favorite is the chicken quesadilla. Quesadillas here are served wet (with lots of sour cream) so it makes the tortilla softer and soggier. Yum! For me, soggier is fine as long as it's in the name of sour cream.

TIP: Come prepared for the ridiculously huge and overstuffed burritos/quesadillas. They didn't name this place "gordo" for no reason.
author: Denise L.

description:
If you're really having a burrito fix this will do, otherwise stay away. My chance of returning is about 12%.

The last time I reviewed this place was in 2010 and it's gotten worse. A lot worse. I'll try again in 2015 if they are still around.
author: Justin S.

description:
I like that they're fast and move things along with efficiency, but the staff seemingly have little to no respect for their customers. Every time I've ordered food here, I've felt as though I was interrupting their conversations. 

Don't expect a hello or thank you here, it's just "next!" and be sure to know when you're next, because they're not there to wait for you! NEXT!

Their burritos are good and reasonably priced. I'd continue patronizing this place, if they weren't so rude.
author: Michael R.

description:
i rarely write reviews, but i thought my experience here warranted one. 

i used to work at the bank of america on 9th and i remember i almost never ate at gordos because the food wasnt the greatest. 

fast forward 10 years. im in the neighborhood and decided to give gordos another try. ugh. if anything its gotten WORSE. 

the carne asada was salty as hell, the soda was flat and the chips were stale. whatever. the kicker was the customer service. the cashier was rude and honestly seemed annoyed to be ringing me up. then at the end he kind of just grabs the cash out of my hand and tosses the change on the counter. look, i get it, you hate your job... but if youre going to be paid for it at least try to summon up some sort of customer service skills. if im being polite and going to your establishment to eat, i expect the staff to be at least cordial.

im summary, this place is terrible. the food sucks and the service is atrocious. spend your money somewhere else. la fonda up the street is mediocre food as well, but at least the staff is polite and friendly.
author: Howard L.

description:
Let me start out by saying I'm in this neighborhood often and frequent this Gordos. It's my go to place for easy and decent Mexican, the service is always bad but my most recent visit was so terrible that I will not return. 

The man who served me wears a baseball cap and is always rude and impatient, I was not excited to see him but proceed to order anyway. One super chicken burrito one regular (no cheese or sour cream as my friend is lactose intolerant). I'm standing there as he added all the ingredients, he asked me several questions like "guac?" "Salsa?" But because it's loud and he spoke very quietly I ask him to repeat each questions. He became irritated and accuses me of "not listening" I say "I'm sorry, I'm having a hard time hearing you and honestly you're being quite rude to me." As he's finishing up I ask if I can order two veggie tacos with the "super" fixings. He's glares at me and rudely replies "we don't have sure veggie tacos" (mind you I've ordered this before) I say okay, well I want two tacos with everything but meat. He rolls his eyes and under his breath says "pendeja" which basically means idiot or asshole. I say "excuse me?! That was incredibly rude, I speak Spanish and understand exactly what you just said". 

At this point. I have the two burritos and walk straight to the register, he yells after me "you don't want the two tacos?!" I look back and clearly state that I have no interest in purchasing anymore food from him and that I do not appreciate his attitude. 

The only saving grace was the cashier who was incredibly apologetic. I feel for him since he has to work with someone so volatile.
author: Feliz M.

description:
Great value in terms of tasty:cost. 

Carne asada could be improved by adding more seasoning. Not much flavor to the carne asada taco I ordered, but the portions and texture was perfect. Extra hot sauce would be good here.

Chicken burrito was much tastier. Rice was flavorful and moist. Other ingredients tasty. Lots of flavorful chicken. Not all that spicy though, again think I'd ask for extra hot sauce. For the price can't go wrong. Would order again. 

Place was clean and health score about as high as I've seen in SF, not sure what some of the reviews are referring to.
author: David G.

description:
SAME complaints as others so what does that tell you?

I've been going on and off to both locations on Geary and to this location on 9th for years. I haven't been to this location on 9th in a while so my gf and I decided to go there today instead of the Geary location we usually go to. The staff was so busy gawking at underaged girls that they should all go pre-register as sex offenders. Instead of doing their SIMPLE jobs of taking the orders, making burritos and moving the line along, they were busy talking to each other in spanish. The guy taking our order must have asked (mumbled) the same questions 5 times about each damn step of making the burritos because he just simply wasn't paying attention. He messed up my burrito of course. Took it back up to politely ask to have it remade and the rude cashier (with the cheapass flea market tats) immediately pops attitude at me... continously. The guy who messed up my burrito makes me another incorrect burrito (no joke) while the rude cashier is still poppin attitude (even though I was still being calm and polite). It took a LOT not to blow up on that clown. This spot has gone downhill like a lot of formerly good spots. I'd give it ZERO stars if I could. Food quality went down the drain. Wtf happened to this place?

Message for the owner(s): Minimum wage cashiers are a dime a dozen. Fire that rude cashier because he seems to have a lot of complaints and you are losing a lot of customers. That cashier needs to check himself. The lazy and sloppy staff needs to pay attention to customers and not make them wait while they are inappropriately conversing with each other non-stop in spanish about the underaged girls and women they are gawking at. Also, the Geary staff is constantly talking to each other when they are supposed to be paying attention to the customers as well.
author: Meghris O.

description: Disputes the bad reviews, I've never had a bad experience here. The carnitas are good, the staff is friendly, and I will continue to be a regular customer
author: Melissa S.

description: Cashier's attitude was awful.  She didn't sound like she wanted to be there.  Chili verde burrito wasn't very good.  the black beans were too salty.  I couldn't taste the chili verde.
author: J W.

description:
I love Gordo's, and especially their burritos.  The filling is always fresh, and they always give more then enough.  They even have healthier options, which what my boyfriend loves.  I must admit that I at first I felt like it tasted a little different.  But once we had it a 2nd and a 3rd time I fell more and more in love.

This location is probably the one that is the HARDEST to find parking at, not to mention that I've experienced much slower service here.  It gets pretty packed, but I'm sure it's because of its location.
author: Pia V.

description:
You gotta wonder about a taqueria that doesn't throw in some chips with their burrito orders.

$1.65 for chips and salsa?
seriously?

Come on, you guys are a local joint.
Don't pull a Chipotle on me.
