I ordered the regular veggie burrito with extra onions and cilantro and added some avocado.
It was very satisfying.

I liked the little bit of kick from the hot sauce and will make sure to ask for a little more next time.

Overall, it's alright for a non-Mission place and a decent option when you're craving a burrito in the middle of the Sunset.
author: Dan B.

description: THE WORST.  super burrito comes wi NO GUACAMOLE , no sour cream nothing but a crappy attitude of the guy ripping off your $$$
author: Kay C.

description: I could give the women who roll the burritos here five stars. If you don't believe in good, fast and cheap; you are dead wrong. Some transplants lament the day when you could get a burrito at Gordo's for less than $4. Boo hoo for them. Gordo's is still an awesome deal. You really should leave a fat tip. When I had a deep fear of carbs and the very thought of rice gave me anxiety, they would make me an all meat burrito in a whole wheat tortilla. Let's pretend I'm the lab rat from up the hill who could talk. I tell you this, cutting out carbs was like taking a pharmaceutical prescription off label. I don't recommend it. Unless you're an ectomorph, eat half of a burrito and give one to a hungry looking student. They love free food.
author: Anna L.

description:
Originally wanted to eat at Nopalito for an early lunch but showed up at 11am to realize it didn't open until 11:30.  Needed something quick but was still craving some Mexican.  Bf guided me across the street to Gordo.  No frills burrito spot.  Ordered a carnitas regular burrito.  Bf got a steak regular burrito plate and a chicken burrito to go.  We also got a super steak burrito for our friend to go.  Everything added together was about $25.  Bang for your buck.

The carnitas was super tender and looked like it had been slow cooked for a long time.  Burrito also had black beans, rice and salsa.  Only wish there was lettuce. Good for what it was.  Tried some of bf's steak....pretty good char on it and tasty.  Speedy service. Order at the counter and eat in or take out.
author: Liv A.

description: Gordo's Taqueria is pretty delicious.  The meat was so fresh and flavorful, and the asada tasted really authentic.  Great portion sizes, too.  My only complaint was that they didn't have horchata.
author: Joni W.

description: I can always count on Gordo's for a quick, cheap, tasty, and filling meal. Especially compared to the other eating establishments on 9th Ave. Gordo is an easy choice. The chile verde is nice, tender, and juicy. The cartinas as well. I enjoy their guac too. It's a good deal for a half pint container. Staff is friendly.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
The mexican food in inner sunset isn't very good. Gordo's is just okay, as rated accordingly. I come here only if I am really really craving mexican and don't want to venture back to the south bay or to downtown. 

Their menu is quite simple, with the selection of tacos, quesadillas, burritos, and super burritos. I usually get a super burrito, and it's fairly large. The last time I went, I got chips and salsa for 1.65 and the salsa comes in a tupperware container thing. You get a lot! props for that. I gotta try the guac next time.

Pros:
- Spinach tortilla!
- Pico de Gallo with chips

Cons:
- food is mediocre

Take the food to a bar nearby (little shamrock, blackthorn), and wash it down with a beer.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
This place was okay. I got my burrito pretty quickly. Carnitas, extra spicy with guacamole. It was hot and quite large, but I found it to be too salty and without a whole lot of other flavors. 

There are some spaces to sit, but it's not the most pleasant seating arrangement. I preferred to take my food to the park. 

The price was about right for the amount of food I got and the quality. I'd say you're paying for quantity here, not so much quality. I would go back because it's nearby, but there are lots of better burrito places.
author: Allxie C.

description: The chicken and steak burritos are the bomb I think it's the best burritos I ever had in my life and I've been eating burritos all my life lol.
author: Nicole A.

description: Quick and easy! The quesadillas hit the spot! They pack it with your choice of meat and any other goodies you want. There a little small (about 3 pieces) but definitely really filling. I will say the prices are a little high but hey if the quality is there you're gonna keep coming back!
author: Jessica B.

description:
I asked for a vegetarian burrito and the guy threw down a tortilla smothered in melted cheese. I told him, sorry I didn't want cheese. "YOU said bean and cheese burrito!" he continues to use that tortilla..I tell him again, I can't eat it and would like it without cheese. He obliges and is obviously pissed. Sorry, you misheard me buddy. The "guacamole" has a sour cream base. Trying to keep things vegan, I should have inquired before.

It's a tragedy when guacamole is ruined with sour cream! Only one kind of salsa, a pico de gallo basically. The food is bland.  1 star because it is cheap. Won't be back.
author: Jane R.

description:
I honestly go to Gordo's when I'm too lazy to leave the sunset area and I'm craving Mexican. Or else, avoid it. It's not that good, the line takes forever and its overpriced. I'll admit, it's passable, but  you'll never find yourself feeling satisfied. You're either underwhelmed or guilty you ate that crap. I also have a problem with places that use sliced cheeses in the burrito so it already gets negative points for me. It's gotta be shredded cheese or bust. Also, the salsa is quite bland. 

Take the N and go down toward the Church/Castro, you'll thank me later.
author: Cody M.

description:
Hands-down, the best grilled chicken burrito in San Francisco -- and possibly on Earth.

I came across this taqueria when I would visit my friends Turtle and Bits in the Inner Sunset and quickly became a fan. Having lived all over the Southwest and traveling often to Los Angeles, San Diego and through Mexico, I've often found myself dreaming about the perfectly grilled chicken breast, exquisitely seasoned black beans, precisely steamed tortilla and the exact balance of cheese that Gordo's offers. 

It was no surprise that the guys behind Dos Toros in New York claims Gordo's as their inspiration for bringing their brand of fast Mexican cuisine to the East Coast.

Perfect. Please don't change a thing.
author: Bruno N.

description:
My two friends and I were in the area and were in the mood for Mexican food. We came to this establishment, hoping to get a good meal, and rest from all the walking we had been doing. I was SO disappointed and offended by my experience here. 

The food was alright, not really memorable. 

My discomfort (and poor review) came from the workers, who completely lack good customer service. I've worked in a couple restaurants before and I acknowledge that it can be tough at times. That does not mean you take it out on the customers!

We were not greeted or acknowledged, and they said, "what do you want?" in such an annoyed way, like they were bothered by us being there. When we were paying, one of the guys didn't even make eye contact, he was having a side conversation with another worker the whole time. I was so annoyed by that, but hat's not even the bad part.

I'm Mexican, and a fluent Spanish speaker. Unfortunately, I was able to understand that the employees were just throwing vulgar words left and right. I didn't even feel like I was in a restaurant at this point. As customers, we shouldn't have to listen to that type of language when having lunch. It's beyond inappropriate and rude. It created a very uncomfortable environment for my friends and I.  

We partly ate our food, and we were finishing up our drinks, catching up with some good conversation. Then my sister and I overheard one of the workers say in Spanish, "they haven't left, they're just taking their time talking and laughing", and then they all laughed about it.    

Uh...EXCUSE ME!?
Since when is it wrong to sit down with your friends, catch up, and try to have a good time? I was so infuriated. I would have been more understanding if we had been causing a riot and being really loud, but it was nothing like that. We immediately felt extremely uncomfortable, and we decided to leave. My friends walked out super pissed off, and on my way out I sarcastically told them, "Sorry for talking for so long!". Definitely not coming back to this place again, why go pay to be treated like trash!?
author: Monica M.

description: We've been going here since we were kids. It's still reasonably priced and still has the same taste. We love it for its consistency and the same guys that been working there for over 15 years.
author: Raylan W.

description:
This is the best burrito ive had in SF, or anywhere else for that matter. Ive only had this location and dont know about the clement one.

The chips an guac are great too
author: Petey F.

description: Solid food, great prices. I wanted to have a light meal, so I went to gordo and ordered a Chile Verde pork taco. I added black beans, pico de gallo, as well as red and green hot sauces, and the he outcome was a delicious taco. The best thing is that I only paid$3.10 for the taco, which I thought was a great value given the quality,and the size, of the taco. Good times if you're close to gg Park and craving tacos or burritos.
author: Herman R.

description:
I've been eating burritos from here occasionally since I was kid, and I'm never disappointed by the quality and now also the price (since I am now old enough to pay for my own burrito). It's a pretty small, typical taqueria, no surprises. I always get the super burrito with carnitas or carne asada, but if I had to recommend one, I'd say try their carnitas! It's so good. I love that they actually prepare your food right in front of you too and they are super fast! I ate inside for lunch once. There are only a few tables so space is limited although it's never really crowded. We decided to sit in the front facing the window to people-watch, but ended up eating our meal in front of a homeless guy. Buzzkill, and I felt bad so I ended up buying him a quesadilla on my way out. Anyway, this place is also super close to Golden Gate Park so you could enjoy your food there too.

It's not Mission-quality Mexican food, but it's a decent place and probably the best you can find in the Sunset!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
ONE STAR for STRING IN MY FOOD and a distinct LACK OF RESPECT for the ladies.

CHEWED A THREAD CARE OF GORDO'S...  Got to the bottom of my tasty boiled chicken super burrito and then realized I was chewing something that was not edible.  Yep a string that looked like it had been boiled in with the chicken.  And not just a little bit.  Like you, I expect to get good safe food when I eat out, so this put me at 2 stars... as a warning.

LACKING RESPECT FOR WOMAN PATRONS... A little respect goes a long way, a lack of respect goes much further.  We drop by here today to pick up a phone order I called in and the staff serves every man in line and ignores my wife who is standing patiently at the counter.  This goes on until another male patron who's walked in well after my wife, points this out to the staff when they continue to ignore her and try to serve him.  Bonus negative stars for being surly once they finally decided to serve her.  Took this from a 2 star to a 0 star review if I could give it.

THIS IS MY FIRST LESS THAN 3 STAR REVIEW... I am not a cranker.  Normally I would hold my tongue... I mean business owners gotta stay in business and people need jobs... but this was a bit much for me.  Check out my other reviews, this is the lowest I have ever given.  I would not return.
author: Sam L.

description: I was under the impression that this place was really special, a Sunset district favorite. It wasn't particular special to me. The regular pork carnitas burrito was especially dry for some reason. Not sure if it's because it's been lying under the heat lamp all day. Probably didn't help that they skimp on salsa... it's mostly rice and beans.
author: Gerald C.

description: I recently came here for burritos and on another occasion tacos and found the food to be completely flavorless. I'd go around the corner to La Fonda next time I'm craving Mexican.
author: julia k.

description: Really good burritos and tacos. Easy menu and great service. Nice place to bring the kids.
author: Joshua W.

description: The Sunset is in dire need of a good taqueria. I used to think Gordos was decent, but upon recent visits, it's been pretty dismal. Bland asada, weak hot sauce, no chips included, and I think they just started using smaller tortillas for their burritos. A world apart from the standard SF-quality burrito you'd find in the Mission. If you're in need of a Mexican fix, just go to Nopalito across the street, don't waste your stomach here.
author: Dave H.

description: YUM!! A San Francisco treasure and still my favorite Taqueria in the city. So lucky to have a Gordos right next door. Perfect in all ways!! Delicious, fresh and fast!! I LOVE Gordos and so will you.
author: susan h.

description:
This place use to be my go to spot back in my middle school days. 

I came here recently to reminisce my childhood. I ordered the Super Burrito with Steak. Total was around $7 

The burrito looked pretty small in my standards and it was just okay. 

They definitely have the same menu since many years ago, but I feel like the burritos definitely got smaller. 

Also, there was only one worker working on a Friday night. The line was pretty long which surprised me that no one else helped this one guy.
author: Adam J.

description: My review is going to be biased because Gordo's was pretty much all that my friends and I ate after church during high school. So when I eat here it's not because the food is particularly special and high-quality or anything. I'm eating it for it's no-frills fatty deliciousness. I'm eating it for a particular taste and feeling it gives me--one that has miraculously not changed for over a decade. It's nice that such experiences still exist. And to be honest, tonight was my first time trying Gordo's in the Sunset, but I had been to the two locations in Berkeley and I think they are pretty much all the same. My default is a super burrito with boiled chicken and black beans in a spinach tortilla. I also like their quesadillas because they're just ridiculous. Normally, I like some guac with my Mexican to make it less dry, but when it comes to Gordo's, get the sour cream.
author: Tiffany H.

description: For the neighborhood Gordo's is a good option. The prices are cheap, the staff friendly, and the food is decent.
author: Cody H.

description: I actually really like the food here. It's cheap and tasty.  The service however is Terrible.
author: Amit D.

description: Good, quick, cheap!! Had a burrito, filled me up and get inexpensive. Exactly what I was hoping for.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Man, I so want the food here to be better than it is. It's not horrible, but it's really lacking in some ways. Too bad because good Mexican food is so hard to find out here on the avenues. Wish I could get a great burrito without the trek to the mission. 

I have a couple issues with the burritos at Gordo. First, they are never tightly wrapped so the thing falls apart halfway through and spills out. Ideally a burrito should be just the right width and very tightly wrapped so you can eat the whole thing without it caving until you get down to the nub. My second problem with the burritos is the texture - they always seem too wet. I think they don't properly drain the beans so that you get too much moisture in the burrito. The quality of the meat is pretty good. I think their carnitas is nicely cooked, expect for a few burnt dried pieces that can make their way in. Their steak is just ok - I like it more finely chopped than they do it here and the flavor leaves something to be desired. My last complaint is about the rice - for some reason I just don't like the way it tastes - it's almost under-seasoned. Hard to put my finger on it. Anyway, all in all, it will fill you up and there's nothing so wrong with it, but their burritos really don't hit the spot the way you want it to.

Maybe someday the sunset will get the awesome taco shop it deserves.
author: Sam S.

description:
My sister and I opted for Gordos since the taqueria we wanted to go to was closed. We've walked by many times but never stopped in, so we wanted to try something new.

First off, the menu did not have any descriptions as to what was included. We found this to be confusing and when we asked about the menu, the man helping us didn't speak much English which made our experience even more confusing. Although the standard fix ins (beans, sour cream, guacamole, etc.) were present, it would have helped to see exactly what we would be getting. 

I ordered Carne Asada Tacos which I found to be bland and mediocre. The tortilla chips were pretty good, but they do charge for a small brown bag of them. 

I wouldn't return because the food did not leave an impression on me and the vague menu was a hassle.
author: Juliette R.

description: There's something about this place that's really good. I'm really not sure what it is. I always get a carne asada burrito with all the fixins and it's delicious. It may be perhaps every time I've gone it's always been a long day at work and there's just that craving for Mexican food. It's just so satisfying and delicious. Also a plus that they have Jarritos. Love Jarritos. Anyways, I'm always happy after eating food from this place. There is some seating inside and it's never packed. I think most people just order to go.
author: Julie L.

description: If you want a bland burrito that will make you feel terrible after you eat it, come here! Also, the staff was probably the angriest group of people I've seen all week.
author: Sean S.

description:
I'm only addressing the quality of customer service. Three employees talked amongst themselves while a friend and I waited to be helped. The employees seemed far too busy watching a video on an iPhone....so we waited, waited, and waited....I finally asked  "can I have a carne asada taco?" (Felt soo bad interrupting the bromance..) ...man #1 put a tortilla on the grill and went back to the important footage on the phone. There were ZERO other customers in the place. It's a shame, I like Gordos, but I'll never come back to this location. (If you're wondering what happened to my friend, he left...even after he asked for a burrito, he was never acknowledged).  

Oh! Forgot to add this...after my friend walked out, two additional employees walked out from the back! So that's atleast five employees...three of which I witnessed NOT working, but BSing around (..and look we've all been there, done that...but the rule is NOT to BS when they're customers around!)
author: Chelsie D.

description: This is by far the worst Gordos location to go to. The workers are not friendly, and twice they gave me carnitas that wasn't cut up enough and was hard as a rock! Gordos on Geary is the best gordos to go to!
author: Jade C.

description:
Burritos are incredible 
Have been coming for 20 years or more.
Currently, there is a real jerk behind the register at 9 th avenue location.  Doesn't smile and never says thank you.  Actually gives dirty looks if you ask a question.  If you tip, which I always do, not so much as a quick thanks or nod.  Anyway, I won't let this one prick ruin the efforts of the rest of the staff.  I will keep coming and keep tipping however Management needs to do something about this guy asap.
author: teri p.

description:
Came in here recently because I was around the area. They still did not improve from the last time I was here which was like last year. I thought the burrito was not flavorful -it was actually pretty plain. Also all the saltiness from the chicken was all at the bottom which was not good/no balance. Customer service was not the best from this guy who made my burrito. could they at least not have an attitude like they are impatient when customers are deciding (is it so wrong that some of us are very indecisive?). It wasn't really bad attitude but they could have been more friendly or neutral like the one on Geary -its just unappealing/such a turnoff when customers aren't treated with value. The other employees were fine. 
I'll stick to the Gordo on Geary.
author: Carmen L.

description: The worst place I ever seen. Customer service is horrible. The guy was mean from the minute i stepped in to pick up my order. never go to this place . 0 stars
author: Ialanta A.

description: Best burrito on the planet. Bar none. As close to a religious experience as one can have.
author: John P.

description: Quick service and pretty good burritos. If you can't make it out to the mission, this is probably the best in the sunset, at least.
author: Dakota S.

description:
After going to the DeYoung Museum went to Gordo Taqueria for a late lunch.  I was the only customer when I went, more came in afterward.

I got:

Bean & Cheese taco $2.35 - you can get pinto or black beans.  Got black w/ some kind of cheese & you can get rice if you want.  Hot sauce he gave me was green which I couldn't tell if he even put any on.

Chicken taco $2.55 - you can get pinto or black beans, I got the boiled chicken which was ok for me.  You can get rice too.  Ask for more sauce because it's pretty bland at the register.  They have take-out containers the cashier can give you.

Nothing special about the food, I'd recommend eating elsewhere.

Chips & salsa Extra, Not free.

Charge it!

One unisex bathroom in the back.
author: Ann L.

description: My favorite burrito place next to Zorros burrito in downtown San Francisco! Cheap and delicious
author: Deanna L.

description: The food was bland. The place looked dirty. And the service could've been better. This place is not worth your time or money; there are so many better places you can find. The quesadilla that I ordered did contain a lot of meat, so I guess that's one positive thing for those looking for a bigger portion.
author: Elena P.

description: I've been coming here ever since my childhood friend from elementary school took me here back in 1991-1995. The burritos are always delicious to me, I mainly like the chicken w/ cheese, beans, rice, and salsa. The only thing I always notice, but shouldn't really matter too much is the staff never looks friendly at all. Let's just say if I wasn't ordering food, the staff would make me feel like I'm in a hostile environment. But definitely a good cheap eats place to go to.
author: Pudgy G.

description: This place has legit food! But you might get yelled at by the cool hipster if you want hot or mild salsa.
author: Elina B.

description:
While other people my age were flying back to the Bay Area to visit their families, I was flying back to visit Gordo's.

A friend of mine introduced me to this amazing place while I was a sophomore in high school (there's nothing like a good burrito after biking/skateboarding halfway across the city), and Gordo burritos have become a staple in my diet ever since. There's nothing like a super beef burrito with black beans, extra meat, hot sauce (the green one) and sour cream. Oh my goodness... 

I'm pretty sure the beef they put in their burritos is actually bits and pieces of angels. Its that good. 

That being said,  I make it a point to stop by Gordo for a burrito on the way back from the airport everytime I'm in town. 

The place is usually busy when I'm there, sometimes you can find a chair, sometimes you'll have to wait a bit. Afternoons during the week you're likely to run into moms and tiny bottle sucking people with strollers littered all over the place, museum workers and other locals on their lunch break. Its pretty close to the park so you could grab lunch and take it outside, or take Lincoln down to the Ocean Beach (if you prefer your burritos full of sand). Parking on 9th is usually interesting, but not impossible. Sometimes its a lot easier to drive up to Irving and park there. Either way, I've never not found a parking space, so you're not allowed to use that as an excuse for why you've passed up the best burritos in well... anywhere.
author: Jason B.

description:
With any other cuisine, I expect a fair amount of ambiance when I walk in, but with Mexican restaurants, the inverse seems to be true. The less mariachi music I hear and the fewer sombreros on the wall, the better the food usually is. 

And that holds true with Gordo's, my favorite burrito in the Sunset or the Richmond. All the budget that normally goes into the decor got reallocated to the meat, where it belongs! Get the 'all meat' burrito after a run through Golden Gate Park if you want to know what protein heaven tastes like. 

Chips and salsa are extra, but chips might be worth it when the burrito eventually self-destructs in your hands and now you have taco salad. There's a small beer selection and a soda fountain, and good on them for having a community bulletin board, but you don't care about that. You care about the burrito quality, and they get my seal of approval.
author: Kevin B.

description: This is my favorite burrito place. They put a slice of cheese and steam it with the tortilla. There's always a line if you go during lunch or dinner rush.
author: Tina L.

description:
Mediocre burrito. Got a regular chicken burrito. The guac. that I added was a nice touch. The black beans had no flavor. The chicken was good. I payed over $6 for it, not sure if they charged me for reg. or super bc I got regular. Anywho, not stressing over 50 cents, but have definitely had WAY better burritos. Disappointed I wasn't impressed... Heard it's supposedly pretty good.

Also, guac is extra and they give you maybe a tablespoon..
author: Anna B.

description: I have been going to Gordo for years, and love it. They have terrible burritos that I love. I also get a quesadilla and fill it with the same ingredients as a burrito, it's fantastic, adds a little crispness . This is fast and delicious.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I've been on a mexican binge lately, and it's too bad that Gordo's does not cut it. $5.5 for a super burrito, it's affordable for being in the city, but I will let the El Pollo Loco guy say it best "it lacks FLAVOR"!

The Carnitas were well cooked, but tasted little more than braised meat. There was not enough spice or salsa in the burrito, so the whole thing was quite bland. 

I was lured in by a smell in the air, but unfortunately was quite disappointed.
author: Vince E.

description: For years my friend told me Gordo's was the best. She would say whenever she was stressed, " I just wish I had a burrito from Gordo's. They are the best." Since she is from the Bay and now lives in Chico, I would always say, " you are just homesick. Gordo's can't be that good." Well, I was wrong! They are amazing!!! My daughter and I shared a bean and cheese burrito and could not believe how amazing it was. The rice inside of it was so seasoned perfectly and everything about our burrito was beyond delicious. Thank you Gordo's! You are not just a Bay Area childhood dream of my friend's thinking you are great, you really are great!
author: Erin P.

description: Gordo's is "No Bueno"! Awful food, drain the meat and beans, give out fresh salsa and act more polite! Not ever coming back!
author: Kakamani C.

description: I've been going to this place for probably 20 years, give or take, and I don't know why there are so many negative reviews. I don't give a damn how piss poor the service may be (it never has been for me...except when the new guy making my burrito seemed like he had ADD and couldn't focus) But their burritos are delicious and corporate Chipotle has NOTHING on them....I read someone's review who said their corporate crap was better. Their food has flavor and I have never had a bad burrito from there. My husband's only complaint is that they're never spicy enough, but he says the flavor makes up for that. They're quick to make the food, and even when I take it to go, it still tastes delicious by the time I get home (which is about a 15 or 20 minute drive.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Gordo's is another one of those places my father always took me as a kid as he introduced me to new and wonderful flavors.  From what I can recall, some of my earliest memories of enjoying burritos were from this San Francisco staple.

This was my first revisit to Gordo's in years so I decided to stay safe and order a carne asada super burrito.  Unlike Taqueria San Jose's super burritos, this one did not come with guacamole and sour cream and I had to add that separately.  While Gordo's makes a very tasty burrito, I have to admit that my favorite is still from Taqueria San Jose in Marin.  I think that the meat is the difference, and San Jose's is much better seasoned.

Gordo's is still one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the Bay Area and really know how to throw down a mean burrito.  While it has been a while since I last visited, it has also been a while since I was in the Bay.  Since it's located just a few blocks from when I'm staying, I may have to grab one for the plane flight back to San Diego, because it's still better than what we've got down there.

Food: 8/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Absolutely the worst experience I've had in any restaurant. 
1) Out of the four or so men behind the counter three said VERY unprofessional, aggressive things about women IN the restaurant in Spanish. Since I'm white,  they probably assumed I don't speak Spanish. These men are vile to say the least.
2) I ordered a quesadilla with "everything except meat", the man behind the counter made eye contact with me and then ladled nasty looking chile verde onto it, folded it up, and slid it down the counter to the cashier to whom I told I ordered a vegetarian quesadilla. He walked over to another employee and told him that I wanted no meat. They whipped up another quesadilla real fast and sloppy.  The cashier rung me up for both and refused to give me either until I paid for both. So I paid for both as I was on my lunch break and didn't have time to get food elsewhere. Figured I'd give the meaty one to my bf when I got home from work. 
3) I took two bites of mine. It was so greasy I couldn't stomach it.
author: O M.

description: Not my favorite burrito, but the carnitas burrito is nice and filling after spending some time at Golden Gate Park. The pico de gallo salsa is pretty good too.
author: Teryll H.

description: Yummy tacos and burritos - huge portions at low prices. Fresh ingredients. Not much atmosphere when eating at the restaurant, but worth the stop in for a quick lunch! Huge portions of guac, too!
author: K. L.

description: This place is missing beer. It's also missing happy staff. It's got that real prison kitchen feel! Food's not bad.
author: Nick B.

description:
This place has been a staple of my Mexican eating diet since I was a kid. With their varying locations it was always easy to get your burrito on in 10 minutes or less (9th Ave just happens to be my local Gorods). 

The meat is fresh and cooked right there on the spot and sometimes right in front of you. My favorite being the grilled chicken. It always has a great char to it but yet remains juicy. Black beans are my go to bean. Their guacamole is just right and offsets all the spicy sauce I just love to add in. I love that they have different types of tortillas- varying from corn, wheat, and tomato! 

They do have other items on the menu but believe it or not I never have ventured out since the burritos are just great! 

The guys behind the counter are always friendly and even if there is a line it usually moves really fast. Prices havent changed in ages or at least it seems that way. Burrito, 1/2 pint of guac, chips, and a drink allllll for about $10. YOU CANNOT BEAT THAT!
author: Michelle I.

description: I'm an SF native. Been coming here for 35 years. One of the best burritos I've found, consistent,fresh ingredients and that trademark Gordo taste that we all love and come back for, year after year. Viva Gordo!
author: Armand C.

description:
My favorite burrito in SF.  And of all time.  The standard by which all other burritos are measured.

Highlights are carnitas and the corn quesadilla (which is served like a crispy taco).  The most indulgent thing on earth is a crispy corn quesadilla with carnitas.  I rarely felt justified getting one, but it's a thing of beauty.

My standard order was: regular buritto with cheese, rice, "just a little" black beans, half chicken half carnitas, guac, extra pico d gayo, extra spicy (more green sauce), and an extra container of green sauce to pour on each bite.

On a sunny day, you can get a burrito and a Coke and walk across the street to the park to sit on the bleachers and watch baseball.

Notes... 

Here "regular" burrito means the size, not what extras you get on it.  The regular with cheese has the same size slice of cheese they put on the Super, so you get a higher cheese ratio with the Regular.

I used to eat here up to 3-8 times a week, every week, until I moved out of the city.
author: Brandon G.

description: Worst burrito I've had in a long time, walked over 10 blocks from Golden Gate park because I always see the sign and wanted to try it. Ordering is awkward and I watched as several people came in and didn't know where to stand to order. Trying to order with the 5' tall glass barrier between you and the burrito artist forces women and short people to shout their orders in the already loud atmosphere. I got a super and it was smaller than a regular at other places, the taste of everything was bland and lacked seasoning. I got steak yet it was swimming in some liquid like stewed chicken. If you walk in and there are only men making the burritos, and not Mexican señoras just walk out.
author: Sky M.

description: So delicious. The asada is melt-in-your-mouth good. Great prices. Super burrito is totally worth it. There's only 1 salsa and it's green and not very spicy. The rice has great flavor. Three different choices of beans, pinto, black, and refried, all delicious. Highly recommended.
author: Lisa V.

description:
Awful service.  The cashier (a man with tattoos on both arms) at this place has the absolute worst attitude.

When I brought my burrito up to the cash register, he told me a price higher than what was on the menu (The menu said it was $6 and it ended up being close to $9) Because I only had enough cash in my hand for the price on the menu, I asked for a second while I pulled out more cash from my bag.  To my surprise, he instantly proceeded to the next customer and told me in a very harsh tone, "You can't play around by not having your money out."

I was shocked.  I have never encountered rudeness like this at any restaurant or business.  I can accept him proceeding to the next person in line, but they way he spoke to me as a customer is totally unacceptable. You would think he would be grateful to receive business.  

Folks, don't support this place. They clearly have no idea how to treat customers and are flat-out disrespectful. I don't care if there food is good or not, I wouldn't come here if you paid me.
author: Richie M.

description:
There was a time that I could finish a Gordo's super steak burrito: guacamole, salsa, sour cream, extra cheese and all. This was a typical lunch for me during my high school days, and I can't think about growing up in San Francisco without Gordo's, my all time favorite taqueria. My friends and I took the bus until were old enough to drive ourselves there, where we would chat over our jam packed burritos and sweet horchata. 

Gordo's supreme burrito crafters know their stuff. With their agile hands they effortlessly handle the hot tortilla and ladle perfect scoops of meat (and some meat juice), topping off the mountain of food with slathers of guacamole and whatever you like. Ask them for some sliced avocado if you're feeling up to it, and please don't forget the extra splash of hot salsa. The finished product is always massive, and be ready to be at least one pound heavier--10 times happier--after consumption. 

I've read some reviews about the burritos being bland, but to me, the intermingling of flavors is just right. Stick to what they do best; the grilled meats and carnitas are mouthwatering, and the "super" option ensures that you have it all. There's nothing more subjective than one's burrito preference, so I suggest taking a taste for yourself if you haven't yet. At the very least, you'll find that you've got your money's worth. 
And yes, maybe they don't always get everything right, but hey, it might just be good to switch it up from refried to pinto once in a while.
author: Desiree C.

description: I love Gordo's.  I've been going here since I was a kid.  I love pretty much everything they have on the menu.  Their grilled chicken is screaming and I also love their chili verde.  My favorite item is a boiled or grilled chicken "all meat" burrito.  If you get a chance, try one of their carnitas quesadillas. They are mouth watering.  If you are ever in the neighborhood and  looking for a quick and fairly healthy bite to eat, try this place out. You will not be disappointed.
author: Rob M.

description:
Went here from the reviews on yelp. Small Burrito place, a fair amount of seating.
 We ordered Chicken, which were lacking flavor and the staff was actually kinda rude. At all other burrito places when you order a burrito supreme, that includes  sour cream & Gauc. not at this place. they charged us for each item. So I'm not sure what was the point of the "supreme." We Also ordered the "Salsa" OMG it was the worst I've had. It was just chopped tomatoes & Onions. No Flavor, Huge chunks.  I don't think I'd go back.
author: Yvonne P.

description: Their burritos are good, not great. I had been going to this Gordo for a few months before I had finally got tired of the (evening) staff. They are the type of people that will ignore you until they finish their conversation, and then act like you are an inconvenience.
author: Sean M.

description:
You know, everyone always talks about how getting old is bad...and they are right.  However, one nice thing about getting old is that you've learned what's good and what's not as good.  Or I would hope at least.

So with that, I start to wonder about Gordo's - have I just found more places that I like better, or have they really started to slip a bit?  I haven't been here in a while, and ended up picking up some food to split with the fam.  Ordered the Carne Asada Super Burrito, a Carnitas Taco, and a side of Chips and Salsa.  The value still works for them, as all of that only cost about $10 or so pre-tax, so kudos to them for staying budget friendly.

The Carne Asada super burrito is still about the same - plenty of rice and beans, good helping of meat, and I had some guacamole thrown in there as well.  Definitely consistency there as it still tastes like the first one I ever bought.  However, have their carnitas always been this greasy?  The taco was just dripping with oil.  It tasted good, but still...so much oil.

Also, maybe it was just a bad batch, but their salsa was just sad.  It tasted so watered down, with the only distinct flavor being cilantro...AND I HATE CILANTRO.  As in, I abhor the damn thing.  So you can imagine how a (small) part of me just died with that first and only bite of salsa.  It's not so bad if it's just a trace in the background, but not when it's the only flavor.  Gordo's, I hope you rebound on my next trip, because I want to shed a tear right now that you aren't my favorite anymore...and for that salsa.
author: Mike L.

description:
FOOD POISONING ALERT!
I will never go back to this place again, i had a carnitas burrito and my stomach feels extremely awful that night. The food tastes horrible too, I could only taste the sour cream in the burrito, everything else (the meat, salsa, rice) tastes flat. Chipotle tastes better than this crap. Do not go to this place unless you're looking forward to sitting on a toilet all night!
author: Bo C.

description: The tacos are reasonably priced and pretty good. The service is quick and friendly.
author: Terry T.

description: If you're on your way to spend a day at Golden Gate Park, be sure to stop at Gordo's on 9th Ave. Small place, but the food is great! I go there every time I go to the DeYoung or Academy of Sciences. Be sure to get the super burrito.
author: Eric M.

description: I thought the carnitas super burrito I had for lunch was just perfect. So tasty. Friendly enough service.  Price was very reasonable. Highly recommend this little hole in the wall taquaria.
author: Ron L.

description:
i think i was charged for a super as i got a regular and chips are extra

that assembly line is militant but can't blame 'em when folks are asking for a lil more rice or light on this or opting for the spinach colored tortilla.  although its with a may I, can I and please which is far better than the um um yea lemme get some extra sauce crowd

now that im done venting its a great burrito and the place to grab one in the area as the price is right
author: Clark G.

description: Gordo is close to my home but shoot- the burritos are inconstant.  Sometimes they are good and sometimes not so much.  To be fair I grew up in the Mission and El Faro on 20th and Folsom was the gold standard - are there beginning in the 1970's. They sold that location so the gold star is El Faro on Kearney. Some of the ladies from the Mission are there which is nice.  Back to Gordo- not great.  We need an El Faro owned by the original family in the Sunset!
author: Donna M.

description: The burrito maker/chef had a cut on his finger. Blood. Little bandaid. No glove. It was disgusting. This place is unsanitary and gross. It should be shut down by the health department. If you don't want some random fresh human blood in your burrito. Don't go here!!!
author: R T.

description:
i LOVE this place.  Order a quesadilla with grilled chicken and add rice and beans with all the regular toppings.  This item is to DROOL for!  It's not for the light eater so either plan on feeling completely stuffed after wards or you will have a late afternoon snack.

Just came here on Sunday after running the San Francisco 1st Half Marathon and this TOTALLY hit the spot.  Oozing cheese, hot rice, black beans, grilled chicken, sour cream and guac all wrapped in a crunchy tortilla.  omgeeee... I'm drooling right now just typing it!  

I haven't really tried anything else here even though I've been going to Gordo's since i was 5!  But, it's very reliable and reminds me of home.  Can't go wrong coming here!
author: Sandy L.

description:
NO!!!!!!! 
I just moved to SF from San Diego and I needed my Mexican food fix. I was excited to see that there was a burrito stop nearby my new place. 
It does not compare to SD at all. The burritos are tiny, expensive, and definitely not as delicious. I guess I will not be able to find my 2 lb, $5, filled with Mexican goodness burrito in SF. Even their SUPER size doesn't compare to SD's kid's size burritos. 
nevertheless, MY SEARCH CONTINUES.

Gordo is similar to Chipotle. They have all the ingredients laid out and they heat up a tortilla for you and you let them know what you'd like inside.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I've gone to Gordo Taquerias (all 3 that I know of) ever since I was in high school (a loooooong time ago) and I've always loved it. It's cheap and tasty. They're quick to make your burritos. It's nothing less than what you would expect from a taqueria. 

I like super burritos with carne asada, no beans, salsa, guacamole, sour cream and hot sauce. It's about $7 for that but it's still a cheap and filling meal.
author: Connie Y.

description: The chicken burrito was OK but the carnita burrito was terrible. The pork was hard as a rock, couldn't even eat it. It was like they had microwaved it until it was hard as cement.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I am always in the mood for Mexican food. Always.

Whilst (yes, I said whilst) enroute to Stow Lake, the boyfriend insisted we stop at Gordo Taqueria. Having heard him rave about this place on numerous occasions, I couldn't say no. And again, I am always in the mood for Mexican food. Always. 

What I found...

The staff was friendly. The service was fast. The look and feel of the restaurant only adds to the authentic Mexican taqueria ambiance.

We each ordered the carne aside burrito. Y-U-M-M-Y

Well worth all of the hype I had been hearing. I will be sure to return. 

Multiple locations.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Damn good burrito!

Some people may complain that it might not be "authentic" but when you make a mouth-watering burrito, does it really matter?

I opted for the all meat burrito with a spinach tortilla.  yes, they offer 4 different types of wraps for your burrito (whole wheat, tomato, spanish, corn)  and when they say all-meat, it really is all-meat, there was chicken, beef, pork, and probably even more beef/pork.  each meat was well prepared.  the chicken was grilling on the grill, the beef was braised and soaking in the sauce, this place does meat right.  then they shove it all inside your  burrito for under $6. 

that's hard to beat! 5/5!
author: Mike L.

description:
MMMM bodybuilding food... quick, bland, and fairly cheap.. 

3 stars because they've been going cheap on my gordo platter... MORE meat please.
author: Andrew V.

description:
I love the quesadilla more then life its self! I had to move to LA a few years ago and can't find anything near it hear. If some one lives in LA and knows where I can go please let me know!
Thanks!
author: John D.

description:
When it comes to Mexican food, the fresher the better. The burrito I had was decent and fresh enough (nothing to write home about mind you). The problem seemed to be with the attitude of the staff. They were efficient but seemed to be annoyed with having any customers. I don't expect employees to kiss my ass by any means but a little courtesy would be nice. 

A little advice for Gordo's, people MIGHT come back if the food is good but they will ALWAYS come back if the service is good.
author: Brenna L.

description:
Decent burritos without the excitement of the extras from Chipotle and Freebirds like queso dip, cilantro rice, etc.  I liked that they melt the cheese onto the tortilla first.  Didn't like that the tortilla was soggy.  I prefer it a bit crispy.

Good for a quick lunch but nothing to write home about.
author: Victoria C.

description:
I recently got the app Chef's Feed. After spending the day walking through Golden Gate Park, I checked to see if there were any recommendations in the area. The first place we checked was closed for the day. However, Gordo Taqueria was just down the street, so we decided to give it a try.

I ordered the carnitas burrito with the Chef's Feed version (crispy bits of carnitas, extra green sauce). It was really good. I would definitely go back.

My wife got the all meat burrito with guacamole. It was pretty good too, though my burrito was better.
author: Danna C.

description:
Greasy, oily, and yet...bland?

I was inspired to write this review after rethinking my interpretation of quality Mexican food. Gordo's is not good Mexican food. Hell, he might not even be Mexican.
I was inches away from giving Gordo's one star, but I oftentimes appreciate bland, tasteless food, and for that, Gordo's gets two stars.

Service, however, is horrible, and if you eat meat, they skimp out on everything. You have to pay for the chips, which usually come free from most taquerias, and in all seriousness, I don't know why this Gordo's sucks so much. Either head over to La Fonda a couple steps away or head to the Richmond where the other, better Gordo Taqueria is.

Compared to this Gordo's, Richmond Gordo makes burritos out of rainbows and sunshine.
author: Colleen M.

description:
My favorite place for taqueria burritos that isn't in the Mission. 

Cheap, delicious and fast. Carnitas or Steak are my favorites, and on a nice day you can grab your food and walk down to the Botanical Gardens nearby for a great lunch date or just a nice lunch with a book. 

Great place, though staff is hit or miss. Some of the dudes working are nicer than others.
author: Brendan L.

description:
BEST BURRITO IN THE CITY

Simply put for the price you can't get a better burrito, the ingredients are top notch, the beans and meats are all well done, and the rice is on point. Not much needs to be said when comparing this burrito to others.
author: Sebastian C.

description: I really want this to be a 4-star review, especially because the place has so much potential and the copycat restaurant Felipe's in Cambridge, Mass. is so good, but unfortunately the burritos here just are not greater than the sum of their parts.
author: Michael L.

description:
crappiest burrito I've ever had. And trust me, I've had it all. I've lived half of my life in mexico, san diego, and other parts of socal.... I know what a good burrito is. I have made better burritos and I am not too great at cooking.
  On top of that, I have never been treated so horribly in my life upon walking into a restaurant. I am very tolerable of bad service at times because I completely understand, I'm in the restaurant biz too. And for a local taqueria I don't expect them to go out of their way to make me feel like a damn princess or anything, but they were just downright disrespectful. I won't state the specifics of the dialouge for the sake of that dude's job, but as a manager of a local shop on irving, if I saw an employee talking to a customer like this then it would not look very good for them. I will never walk into that place again. Wish I could give zero stars, but that isn't an option. Go to La Fonda's instead.
author: Bat V.

description:
GORDO! not gordo...GORDO in caps!  For the Spanish speaking novices that aren't in the know, "gordo" means fat.  Is there a cruel joke behind this Gordo Taqueria aimed at me?  Do they secretly know my weakness for burritos and mock me for it?  

I was told Gordo's carnitas are their highlight.  So that's what I ordered, a carnitas super burrito with black beans and a chicken burrito with pinto beans for Bun.  At around ten bucks, you get generous portions of everything.  From the rice and beans to the meat laced with guacamole and salsa, each bite was filled with every ingredient in the burrito.

The carnitas were on point of expectation, but only tipped barely over delicious scale.  After sampling a bite of the chicken, I found it on the salty side.  Compared between the two, the carnitas were definitely better.  I'll have to try out their other meats with a special curiosity for the chili verde.

The obvious reason to come here is for a decently made burrito in mere seconds.  At five bucks you can have enough for lunch and dinner at an affordable price.  My personal preference still leans toward El Burrito Express on Taravel with a better tasting burrito and at around the same price.
author: Arnold T.

description:
Bland.

Unless you absolutely require sustenance it tortilla form and do not care what you eat then go somplace else. The carne asada burrito I had was so lackluster I am not even going to bother explaining it.
author: Easwud C.

description:
This is THE place to get your Mexican on in Inner Sunset!

Ok, I have nothing but love for El Farolito down in the Mission. But my fellow Sunset residents: when you don't want to do the trek on BART to 24th & Mission, just come down to Gordo's!!!

I wish I knew about this place sooner. My BF took me here last week and I was impressed with the quality, selection, prices and location of Gordo's! Its super easy to find on 9th between Irving and Lincoln. (Right next to the Sunset Gym!) 

Gordo's has what you need for your taco, burrito or enchilada fix!
author: Mari S.

description: Meh. This placed used to be amazing - small, cheap and delicious.  For the neighborhood it's convenient and quick. But I'll just stick to Pancho Villa.
author: John D.

description: At the end of the night, the carnitas can be a bit dry yet greasy (seemed like the carnitas had been re-cooked/fried up). The quesadillas are delicious, albeit rather unhealthy, as they are lathered with oil. Service is lackluster. I recommend going here if you are in the neighborhood, need a quick bite, and are not on a low-fat and/or low-salt diet.
author: I Like T.

description: Sooooo disappointed. Should have stuck w/Geary location (where I normally go) but needed to get something at another restaurant on same street as this location, so I went to Judah.  Such a bad decision & I so want my ~$15 back.  Ordered carne asada Gordo plate, a carne asada (corn tortilla) quesidilla, & chips & salsa. Tried to eat (but spit out most of it-TMI, sorry but it's true) the carne asada quesidilla right away and was so surprised that 90% of the steak was fat and grissile (sp?).  Soooo unbelievably bad, certainly not the Gordo's I'm used to.  And it wasn't just the fat, the taste just wasn't the same. Don't know what has happened or if this was a fluke but when u don't live in the City anymore & happen to be near by a beloveD restaurant & this is the result -it literally ruins your night!  my takeaway-stick w/what u know.
author: Forever G.

description:
If you're looking for an inexpensive Taqueria staffed by ungracious, inattentive personnel who serve middle of the road Mexican food, this is the place.

Located on the busy, 9th Avenue corridor between Lincoln Way and Irving Street, patrons enter a large, spare dining room dotted with tables, stools, and a large painting of an idyllic Mexican village. The facade is almost all window, which lets the occasional Inner-Sunset District sunshine pour into the space, Ceiling fans keep the room from getting stuffy. 

I offered a gentleman at the counter a cheery, good afternoon greeting which was met with cold, indifferent silence. I placed my order, which he immediately repeated, getting one of the ingredients I mentioned incorrect. My poor treatment was continued by the cashier, who upon seeing me at the front of the line immediately helped someone else. I got my food and took a seat at a table littered with crumbs from the previous guest only to discover that my Jarritos non-twist off cap was left in place. A return trip to the counter and my cap was removed. 

By now I was regretting my decision to eat here but with food in hand I figured, why not, and proceeded to bit into my chicken burrito. Imagine my astonishment when I realized it was surprisingly good. The chicken was flavorful, moist and evenly distributed. As I ate I looked up periodically at the counter which was peopled by a vast, steady array of neighborhood types including a cop, a guy decked out in Giants gear, two moms with babies, an old couple and several students grabbing a quick bite between glances at massive textbooks. I'll say one thing for this place, it sure is where the melting pot melts.

I know many neighborhood places are austere and run on a tight budget. This one appears to be among them and I'm fine with that. However, there is no place for curt behavior on the part of the staff. If I were the owner I'd attempt to give these gentlemen some customer service training, or at the least, teach them the magic words of please and thank you. I don't think I'll return to Gordo, and if I do, I'll get my food to go.
author: Michael J.

description:
Great burritos and combination plates for the price. I love the carnitas plate. Always a solid meal and very convenient when you're short on time. I'm always surprised at how cheap it is when I pay for my order.

Typically, I'll get my food to go and eat at home. There's not a lot of ambience here, and the chairs are kind of stiff.
author: Jang K.

description:
Definitely a good spot for your late-night-after-many-drinks noms. One of my friends absolutely loves loves loves Gordos and always talks about it. So I definitely had to try it, even though it's been claimed the Richmond location is better.

Decent service, went through super fast. I got a carnitas regular burrito, nothing extra. It's definitely on the better side of mexican food in nor cal but I wasn't all too impressed. The meat was juicy and pretty fresh (not sure about anything other than carnitas), it's on the greasy side. It lacked the full flavour and was a little on the bland side.

Decently sized portions, good price and good for a quick place to grab a bite.
author: Angela K.

description:
Came in on Sunday March 4th, 2012 around 3:30 for a bean and cheese burrito with sour cream and guacamole - along with a small soft drink for less than $6.50 out the door.

The burrito was made directly in front of me - well prepared with plenty of rice, beans and guacamole - could have used a little more sour cream. 

Every table in the place was filled -- I will definitely be back as I found this to be a great value for SF. Only concern was the lack of free chips.
author: Brian D.

description: Gordo is a bit overrated. The food seems fresh enough. But the burritos aren't great. The salsa and cheese both leave something to be desired. Not a bad burrito. But not exceptional.
author: Grey Z.

description: Mauricio makes the best burritos. Whatever you want he throws it in there happily! Denis has great customer service. Huge big deal, come here! It's a burrito.
author: Bridge F.

description: my favorite place to have mexican food, very in expensive and high quality food
author: Shauntik M.

description:
The burritos here are just ok and just above Taco Bell.  If you're in a pinch, it's fine. But, it's so disappointing because it wouldn't take much for it to be better.  The staff doesn't seem to care about the food and what they're doing, the cashiers are unfriendly, and you practically have to beg to get more than one container of hot sauce. I imagine this is driven by the management more than anything.

That said, the spicy salsa fresca here is pretty good and priced very well.
author: Viviane V.

description: Had a carnitas super burrito.  For the price, it was a large amount of very good, but not great, food. I wouldn't hesitate to eat there again.  You could pass on the chips and salsa though.
author: Patrick U.

description:
Holy Smokes! 

Since when does "mild" = BLAND?!?

We just recently moved to the Bay Area from SoCal and I was in the mood for some good Mexican food. Nothing fancy or "gourmet" just a good simple burrito and some chips and salsa. We don't live near the Mission District where I know it would be easy to fulfill my craving. We're in the Sunset area so I Yelp'd a few places and remembered this place and how people keep saying how good it is... so I said "let's go there!".... UGH.

Maybe I'm missing something here but all the positive 3 and 4 star reviews make no sense to me. 
1) The "beef" (supposedly carne asada) was soupy (yes, soupy) and tasted like some other kind of meat.
2) The "mild" salsa was pico de gallo that tasted flat and almost like it had been sitting there for a couple of days
3) Both the tortilla in my burrito and my boyfriend's taco were oily and gross.
4) They charge for chips and salsa (really????)
5) Service was not friendly- the guy rushed us through our order - even though it was obivous by my questions that I had never been there before- and acted like there were 10 people in line... there's was only one couple behind us the whole time we were there.

My first and only impression of this place was not good to say the least...I'll stick to La Playa or Beach Burrito (further drive) or The Taco Shop (yum!) and continue trying some of the other places in the area.

Gordo = Disappointing.
author: Yahra V.

description:
I've been spoiled from living in the Mission. These burritos are weak. Also, the dudes at El Farolito understand English better than these dudes. Sometimes I just think they're messing with me when they just make the most stupid burrito ever.

Also, you literally have to spell out every single thing you want in the burrito. Must be a sunset thing. I don't know. I always want everything in my burrito. I thought that's what "Super" meant.

i probably won't ever eat a burrito from here again. I gave you two tries Gordo, but I'm sticking to the Asian food in the Sunset. 

So sad, no good burritos around me anymore :(
author: kevin l.

description: The beans are watery and there is a distinct lack of options, including no lettuce?! The burritos are a mess to eat because of the watery beans & salsa they pack it full of. And then you have to pay extra for some hard bland chips. Very disappointing. The guys that make your order seem like they are looking down on the ones that don't order in spanish as well, and they talk about me in spanish. I'm not stupid and it's very rude.
author: Venus S.

description:
Solid. Solid burrito.

One of the underrated taquerias in San Francisco. Especially with all the hype surrounding the Mission district's Mexican food scene, it's hard to find other stand outs. Definitely a no frills kind of place with an authentic feel. I ordered a grilled chicken super burrito on spinach tortilla. It was both filling and tasty. Even without a salsa bar, I found myself to enjoy the burrito without the usual dumping of salsa on the burrito tactic.
author: Brian L.

description:
Darn good burrito!  Cheap prices.  I only got a regular chicken burrito and it was big enough to satisfy me.  It was tasty, big and only $5.  

Since this was my first time, i was a little taken aback by the choices.  I kind of just pointed and nodded lol!  I didn't think to ask for hot sauce, which i think it would've added more to the flavor, but i will remember next time.  

I think next time I will try the quesadilla.
author: Jason Y.

description:
My quesadilla was definitely tasty but a bit greasy. If you want something easy to hold and easy to eat - then opt for a quesadilla... but if you're looking to truly get your money's worth...

...the PLATES are much more WORTH IT. They give you a heaping pile of beans, tomatoes, rice, and your choice of meat, and 4 warm corn tortillas wrapped in foil.

The real reason why I only give them 3 stars?
NO HORCHATA!!

How upsetting! I love my horchata!! Gordo's cannot truly be a taqueria without a jug of horchata nearby the counter :( :(
author: Samantha L.

description:
It would require powers of deduction as profound as Sherlock Holmes to be able to understand how a burrito with such great potential to be outstanding merely ends up completely average.

It could be said by a man more hyperbolic then myself that their cinnamon touched Chile Verde could be called some of the best saucy pig parts in the city (the sauce literally being drinkable). I love that their burritos are consistently warm, that a subtle subtle spiciness infuses every bite, that their cheese is always expertly melted, and that their pico de gallo enriches every bite with its magnificent flavor.

Yet, somehow, their burrito's consistently don't make the metaphorical cut. It may have something to do with the steamed tortillas (you get blank looks when you ask for grilled), merely serviceable beans, bland guacamole and anonymous rice, but these flaws alone don't explain how underwhelming and often unfulfilling the burritos Gordo produces. 

It seems to often be the case in the world of Mission Burritos that the whole is greater then the sum of the parts. In this case, the opposite is true, and I simply cannot understand how that is possible.
author: Casey U.

description: I had a burrito and tacos here. My friend got a huge burrito which is quite a dinner actually. Quick fast service and food is ok overall, not really special though
author: Phuong P.

description:
There's not much A+ mexican food in San Francisco, there just isn't. I haven't tried every burrito place in the sunset/parkside/richmonds areas but this place is one of the best. 

Friendly, clean, good tasting but somewhat pricy for just a burrito and no chips.
author: Ben F.

description:
went here last night and ordered the carne asada borrito. I woke up this morning with stomach pains and began throwing up a lot. Please keep the place sanitary...

The food was alright though!
author: Mateen B.

description: Lackluster Mexican food can be forgiven if it's cheap; however this place is not. $5 for a teeny bean and cheese burrito?? I've given this place a few chances due to the convenience factor, but this was the last straw. I won't be coming again.
author: Alex T.

description: This is hands down the most consistent Mexican Burrito stop :) Well, outside of East bay Taco Trucks!
author: Betty B.

description:
This is my absolute FAVORITE taqueria. I now live in Petaluma, but will drive all the way to the city for a Gordos burrito. My entire family loves them too!
This place has been my favorite for as long as I have eaten Mexican food. 
The green hot sauce is to DIE for.
I generally eat small portions for any and every meal, but when I eat here, I order myself a super burrito and a quesadilla- sometimes 2! 
They prepare your meal right in front of you and you can tell them to add more or less of something if you'd like.
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!
author: Ashley M.

description:
Much better burrito this time around. Ordered a regular burrito with black beans with everything. Be sure to order the spicy salsa, otherwise you'll get a bland burrito. Green salsa=the yums. Something about the black beans, the strange sliced cheese and the salsa that satisfies.

I wish they were cleaner in their burrito building station; there was steak in the black beans and the cleaning towel grosses me out.
author: Cori W.

description:
Delicious:
Spinach tortilla, melted cheese, grilled chicken, guac, spicy green salsa.
Great value ($6-$7)
author: Christopher O.

description: Stopped here on the way back from the De Young Museum. I had the Gordos Carnitos plate. It was pretty tasty and the service was quick. The carnitas were tender and juicy, if perhaps a bit under-spiced. The pinto beans were lovely. I ordered a totally unnecessary side of fried tortillas merely because they were served in little brown lunch bags covered in grease spots. Noms. Salsa was fresh n tasty too. If I had to make a complaint it would be that they need some hot sauce bottles scattered around the place. You can get some at the cashier's, but I didn't realize that until tragically deep into the meal. (Watch the green hot sauce. Srsly.) Anyway, lunch was tasty and under 10 bucks. What more could you ask?
author: Paul M.

description:
The Super Chicken burrito is my favorite burrito here.  I also like to get the flour quesadilla with chicken rice sour cream and extra hot sauce

The chili verde is ok and it always to be way over cooked and dry even though it sits in the broth all day.

The carne asada is in my opinion terrible.  I like fresh steak and not steak that sits in a broth that becomes hard.

Never had the tacos here, I have seen them but never really appealed to me....

Close to the house and convenient for me......  Sunset lacks great Mexican food....
author: King L.

description:
Burrito is okay. Whats up with paying for chips and salsa though? Thats bullshit. How   
about giving your customers the necesities instead of nickeling and diming them. WONT COME BACK!
author: Mohammad A.

description:
The food is always decent here, but the people that work there seem like they absolutely hate their jobs and everyone who walks into the store. Especially the burrito makers. It wouldn't shock me too much to to see one of them stab me in the face (it might a little).

I don't need nurturing, and I appreciate the "Get in, get out" mentality at a place that's supposed to be fast, but the guys that put the food together are borderline mean. 

It's not enough to keep me away, though. Still, I would absolutely love this place if there were a little love in the food.
author: Ryan A.

description: I ordered a chicken burrito from this place before, and it was alright. This time I tried the sauteed veggie burrito and it was just bad. The sauteed veggies had no seasoning (tasted like school lunch veggies), which ruined the whole burrito.
author: Danny Y.

description:
Well, this was my go to place in the neighborhood for a quesadilla if I was feeling lazy and desperate for food.

Now all that's changed after I ate a super burrito and now am dealing with food poisoning. Never ever ever again.
author: Catface G.

description: The average review here is spot on.  It's a good burrito/taco without anything special.  Excellent for quick healthy food but no much flavor.  I would rate it equally with a Chipolte burrito.
author: Grey K.

description: This place has turned gross! They have started selling horchata, and it is POWDER!!! Are they too lazy and cheap to make an authentic Mexican drink, that they have to buy powder from the dollar store?!?! You think that people cannot notice if it is powder or the real thing? This place has no class. I ordered a super burrito, and the cook just slapped on a tiny drop of sour cream, probably the size of a cookie, so I told him "That's really not a lot of sour cream, can you put some more?" They charged me for that?!?! Ridiculous. I have been coming here since the 90's, if they do not get their stuff fixed, and put some effort, they will go downhill!!! They should also change their attitude and show appreciation to people who buy their stinky burritos!!
author: Poison I.

description: People who give this place 1 star must be on crack or something. This is the most consistent staple in the city and is simply amazing. I love their freshly cooked and chopped meats, pico de gallo and house made hot sauces. There is also some addictive substance that I cant get enough of laced into their rice. I can honestly say I have been eating here for over 23 years, and have no intention of stopping.
author: D K.

description:
For fast food mexican that doesn't make you feel obscenely fat afterward, Gordos is it. You can come here dressed in anything and just walk up to the counter and order one of their burritos, which is really the only thing to order here--I don't know one person who has come here and not gotten a burrito. Burritos really are the best buy anyway--you get your meat, cheese, salsa, guacamole, beans and everything else all rolled up in a tortilla!! I mean really, burritos are everyone's friends, unless you are counting calories!!!! (tortillas are evil for those people!! heh)

I got the steak super burrito and for a few cents extra this burrito in comparison to the regular one comes with WAY more stuff in it, which is great if you are starving or using this as a pre-drinking meal heh. And this place is great for not being stingy with the guacamole too. I asked for extra spice in my burrito, and it didn't really deliver in that area, but everything else is pretty good. This is gourmet or fancy, but definitely beats chipotle for being a little more authentic ha ha
author: Sarah G.

description: Gordo does not offer outstanding food, but it is very cheap and kid-friendly, so we end up with a lot of takeout from there. They are pretty patient with special requests (like my daughter always asking for two kinds of beans on her burrito). It's acceptably clean and we've never gotten food poisoning, which is more than I can say for every restaurant in the Inner Sunset. Beware the ludicrously long lines during any event in the park, most especially on 4/20.
author: D E A.

description:
$5 super burritos? You can't go wrong. The meat is all fully cooked and not dried out, could use a little more spice to it. Staff is always very nice (been coming for about 5 years), but that may be because they've seen me since I was a teenager. 

Quesadillas are delic, tacos are super filled up and worth the $$$. Always make it a point to stop by and grab a burrito when I visit the city.
author: Coco N.

description: I keep hearing good things about this place so I keep trying them, but I've got to say tonight's burrito was one of the worst I've ever had.  I ordered a chile verde super burrito with extra jalapeños.  What I got was the wettest, most bland burrito I've ever had. I watched them make it and the burrito with "extra" jalapenos included six very small slices of very mild jalapenos.  Honestly, the burrito tasted like eating a bunch of bland mashed potatoes rolled into a subpar tortilla.  Yes, I know this place is cheap, but honestly I think I'd rather go without eating before paying to eat the tasteless mush this location serves again.  If you're considering giving this place a try, don't do it.  Walk around the corner to La Fonda on Irving and enjoy a slightly better experience.
author: Joshua W.

description: Gordo's is a better than average burrito chain, but to unlock the magic you must order their carnitas.  The chewy perfection of their carnitas ranks amongst the top in the bay area.  All of their meats and selections are tasty, but this is the top choice.  Prices are very cheap, and you will never be dissatisfied with the value you are getting.  Gordo's has been a part of my Mexican fast-food rotation for years and it will continue to be so for a while.  Ranks neck-in-neck with El Faro / El Farolito, La Canasta, Nick's Cripsy tacos, and a tick behind Papalote.
author: Andy S.

description: I absolutely enjoy eating Mexican food. I remember seeing this Taqueria here at this spot for quite a while. But I finally came in here today, I ordered the regular size bean and cheese burrito with rice and a coke. The total for both item came to $6 and it such a great way to satisfy that craving for Mexican food. I enjoy the food so much that I'm so going to come here again next time!
author: Bennett W.

description:
I am very familiar with mexican food.  As a mexican and being from San Diego I know not everything is going to be the best but just classic mexican food is my standard.

When I went to Gordo's I ordered a quesadilla, side of guacamole, side of rice, and salsa on the side.

My quesadilla was so greasy that it soaked through the bag, even though it was wrapped in foil.  It had about one slice of cheese in it.  Needless to say it was inedible even after trying to pat the grease off.

The guacamole lacked flavor and was just disappointing.  The rice was classic spanish rice so that was about the only thing I could eat.  

I walked out of there with a $13 bill for food I didn't eat.
author: Lili K.

description: Gordo's has been my go-to place for Mexican food in the Sunset ever since I was in middle school. Delicious, cheap burritos that are hard to beat! I always get a chicken burrito and my friends from out of town who venture over to Gordo's with me are never disappointed!
author: Siobhan S.

description:
I'm sorry but this place is not awesome. I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican food; I like it but its not the first thing that I'll pick to eat - so I really need it to be awesome. Had a burrito, it was not juicy, uber tasty or anything special. Guac was good but overall,  nope, nope, not amazed. I wish that we had gone to Nick's Crispy Tacos instead. Husband loves Mexican food and thought that it was really good, so maybe that means something. I dunno. 

I'm not going back unless someone forces me to.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
The only reason to go here is if you are a GG Park tourist, need food and don't want to wait.  Even then, there are better alternatives.
Both the server and cashier seemed quite put out to be serving food,  a snarl response to our order and disparaging look as he threw a spoonful of meat on the tortilla.  (No overwork excuses, place was empty.)  And the food was ok, few choices of meat, just ok.
If not for the tourists, it would be gine and not missed.
author: Neal S.

description: The only decent mexican food you will find West of Divisadero in SF. The staff is friendly and after few visits they recalled some of our special requests. Cleanliness was never a problem, they never ran out of anything I wanted (granted their menu is not that extensive), and they are extremely affordable.
author: Karen M.

description: Here's a 1-star review for telling me "we're closed, we ran out of food" when I walked in at 9:57pm (3 minutes before posted closing time). If you ran out of food then what are you going to serve the 15 people standing in line inside your restaurant? If you are closed then lock the door but don't tell customers who walk through your open door during business hours "we ran out of food". That's an insult. I would come here from right next door at Sunset Gym after every workout. Not any more. Teach your employees some manners and close your restaurant exactly at closing time. Or when you really do run out of food, lock the door.
author: Hugh M.

description:
My burrito eating days are over but I find a nice Gordo's platter is a really good deal, like under $5 for what ends up being 2 meals, and you can get them to mix your meats, like you can have 1/2 carnitas and 1/2 grilled chicken. Comes w/tortillas, rice and beans and salsa, and you can add guac & sour cream-still comes to about $5.

Once I had some pebbles in my beans. That wasn't cool.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
3 star for the food - steak burrito is actually pretty good.
add a star for the price man:$5.45 - cheapest super burrito ever!

but bag of chips is extra cost.
author: Kent T.

description: The carnitas were really good but one of their staff, I think either the manager or owner was not in a good mood. One of the cooks apparently did something wrong and this obviously blew him up to the point where he was screaming in Spanish to the employees and cursing them off. A lot of very vulgar words were coming out of his mouth. The employees tried to calm him down but he was not giving in. Not professional what so ever. I speak fluent Spanish too so I understood everything, and they knew I did too and yet he still was going off. Good food but NOT PROFESSIONAL. Gordo Taqueria you need to treat your employees and co-workers with respect. This really ruined my tacos.
author: Charlene E.

description:
Excellent spot when we're at Golden Gate Park.

Burritos are excellent. We had a chicken and all meat super burrito for $13. Guacamole and sour cream are extra tho.
author: Peter L.

description:
Gordo, you tricky bastard. I ordered the super burrito, thinking that it came with the guac and sour cream, but in fact the super burrito is just a bigger version of the burrito and the sour cream and guacamole are extra! Khaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaan!!!

Alright, so for about $6, this is still a pretty great burrito. They pretty much only have burritos, tacos, and quesadillas, so it's not exactly a wildly exciting menu. The meat options are pretty standard, but the size is pretty large. The burrito was good, but a little messy due to the very loose wrapping job they do. I like it when they stretch the hell out of that tortilla and make a tight cylinder out of that burrito. The grilled chicken was good, and the balance of beans, rice, meat, and sauces weren't out of whack. 

So a few gripes. I asked for black beans and boiled chicken. He gave me grilled chicken (which I was ok with), and was going to put in pinto beans if I hadn't caught him.
