My comfort food, a super burrito with boild chicken... BUT NOT FROM THIS LOCATION!!!!  I grew up on this staple from the Albany location but the 9th Ave one is just AWFUL!

Ordered the a boiled chicken and a beef super burrito which were both nasty.  Had the chips and salsa which was equally gross. 

I LOVE GORDOS BUT NOT THIS LOCATION.  This location is not a representation of the goodness Gordos has to offer.
author: Alex H.

description:
As a San Jose resident for a few years, I thought that we had the best burrito joins around with La Victoria's and Iguana's. Gordo might (and I say MIGHT) been a contender for the best burrito in the Bay. 

The beauty of Gordo's is watching the employees schlep on the cheese, beans and sour cream. You can even coax them to add "just a bit more" if you'd like. Unlike other taquerias where the burrito-making happens behind closed doors, you see your burrito from inception to creation and finally, ingestion.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Whatever! This place is damn good!  The service can be a little curt, and if you are too stoned, too slow, or just don't understand Hispanic guys speaking real fast, your feelings will probably get stepped on.

Get the Chili Verde super burrito with everything, it's the best.

Complaints would be that the salsa sucks.  It's 90% tomatoes and 9% cilantro and 1% onions.  no heat, no spice, no fire.  That's not salsa; that's tomatoes in a cup.

Coming from LA, I expect to have some heat, some spice to my salsa.  Well, at least it's not Pace Picante sauce.

Oh, and the place is always clean, so that's good.
author: Tristan D.

description:
Pretty much everything about Gordo taquerias is an embarrassment. I grew up on them(another embarrassment) and it is even worse nowadays. The staff still takes pride in fucking up your order if you call it in I hear. If you like this food, you are as unpalatable as the government cheese you are consuming. 

I will give an extra star cuz back in the day I had a couple of super carnitas quesadillas that were bomb at the Berkeley location. I was young and into my grease back then.

****UPDATE****
I feel kinda bad about the government cheese comment as I am not entirely sure this is the case. My parents and I used to joke about it back in the day and so I carried on the tradition to be funny. Please keep in mind, however, that my mom grew up with government cheese and perhaps her jest stems from a bitter knowledge.
author: Boxxxman J.

description:
My boyfriend and I eat here all the time. 

All...the...time....

We also have the same fight every time we get in the car and have to decide where to eat, since asking him to try something new is not unlike suggesting that he have his teeth drilled just for the hell of it. 
But, try as I might to convince him that burritos and pizza do not a feasible diet make, I know that the end of our perpetual bickering match over food ends when I say, "Burritos," and he stops driving in circles. 

I had to ding the one star for the mere fact that I usually end up eating here not of my own free will. However, the food is super cheap, and I have never (really, not even once) had a bad meal here. Plus, they have those really sugary sweet, florescent-colored Mexican sodas that I love, and the staff is always pretty friendly. 

Keep in mind the area is usually pretty busy, so street parking can be hard to come by. But on the upside, service is always ridiculously fast so you save on the meter. Gotta love that!
author: Tiffinie M.

description: Had the Carnitas Super Burrito.  It was of the mostly meat and rice type with Guac and Sour Cream.   Didn't see and options for some fresca tomato or onions and cilantro, but the meat was nicely seasoned.
author: John W.

description:
After I take a long, sweaty hike through the park, obviously the first thing I do is pack the calories back on by getting a (super-)burrito at Gordo! (Sad, but then again I guess that's why Golden Gate Fitness is down the street.)

I've never been to L'Avenida--I'm usually too hungry to walk the extra three blocks to L'Avenida when I can just walk one block to Gordo. I love Gordo thanks to the habits of my roommate and her bf (Ryan H., below). La Fonda isn't bad either, but the staff at Gordo are super-efficient magicians when it comes to making a great burrito. All three are great in my opinion, but Gordo will always have a special place in my burrito-lovin' heart.
author: Richie K.

description: I went here for the first time today.. had a super grilled chicken burrito, and it was THE perfect way to end a long bike ride.. the meat was full of flavor, the spicy verde salsa added a nice kick, and it was cool they had whole wheat tortilla too! (I saw green tortilla too, so its probably spinach) anyways, for $6, the burrito (super, regular) was delicious and HUGE..  I was pretty starving by the time we got there, and I left full and completely satisfied, and still have half a burrito left! can't wait to eat it later.. mmm :)
author: Jennie L.

description: This place is really good, I love their burritos and salsa.  Their salsa is sooo good they even sell it in little containers, yuumm! I always "treat" myself to some Gordo's every now and then since burrito's are pretty heavy, especially Gordo's you get a lot and their prices are very reasonable especially for a taqueria.  Overall I say this area has a lot of good food and Gordo's is one of them.
author: Christina O.

description: I was happy with what I got.  Chicken super burrito with black beans.  Reasonably priced (~$5) and pretty fast take out to go.  I'd rather go here than La Fonda around the corner.
author: Ken L.

description:
Pete and I live close to this location, so we don't have to battle parking as many others do.  We probably come from here at least once a month.  Great value.  CHEAP and yummy.

While the beef and chicken items are good, the carnitas in ANYTHING is really good.  They don't skimp on the meat.  Pete sometimes gets a super burrito without the rice.  I usually get tacos and/or our absolute favorite, the quesadillas.  With or without meat with the crispy flour (corn is tasteless and wimpy as a quesadilla) tortilla and oozing cheese (we add guacamole to it) is the best.  We often find ourselves ordering at least 2 of them (no sharing here) each time we visit.
author: Lani C.

description:
Pretty decent burritos.  Nothing fancy... just fresh meat and their regular burritos are loaded with the goods.  I got a bean and cheese burrito for about $4 including guacamole (they charge extra for guac, sour cream, extra cheese).  I judge Mexican restaurants a lot of times on their chips... even if their food is good and the chips are bad, I won't return.  The chips here are tasty and so is their salsa (which basically a standard pico de gallo), but "mild" has NO spice... so bump it up to medium if you want a little zing.

All in all, a good burrito for a good price... fast and friendly in a good location to hang out in.
author: Jeannette P.

description:
After visiting the feeble sister Gordo on Geary, I had to make a second stop at the 9th Ave location to get a simple order of refried beans, spicy salsa, and chips. It can really be one of the most satisfying night snacks, mixing the salsa into the refritos and yielding a somewhat addictive bean dip for about $2. 
Anyway, at least this Gordo's had refried beans and chips, but they were not worth a return visit. When prepared with any amount of finesse, refritos can be sublime. Lard and salt combine to produce a fabulous mouth feel, the sum is greater than the parts. Anyway, these beans were bland, bland, and bland. Even spicy pico de gallo couldn't save them. I knew I should have gone with al pastor tacos, but I wanted something to dip chips in at my leisure. 
Burritos here are big, soft fatties. In my opinion, too loosely rolled and juicy, but they are cheap, about $4.
author: Candice L.

description:
I have my husband bring home Gordo burrittos - all the way to San Bruno. That should speak volumes about Gordo's whose burritos inspire such loyalty.  Hell my cousin in Castro Valley drives to their Emeryville location.  

Bean and Cheese with a little salsa leaves me wondering how somthing so simple can be so very good.  I also believe their guacamole is some of the best I have every had.  I love their green chile too.

I love that the same people have worked there for so long.
author: Tracie P.

description:
I'm a lover of a good burrito or a couple of tacos in the canonical Los Angeles barrio style (El Taurino on Hoover Street just south of Olympic being an exemplar), meaning that a burrito should contain meat, beans, rice, chopped onions, salsa roja, and nothing else; and a taco should consist of two fresh soft corn tortillas topped with meat, cilantro, onions, and salsa roja and nothing else.  I love avocado but it has no place on a burrito or a taco.  Sour cream or cheese should not even be an option.

Given these prejudices, Gordo Taqueria makes very respectable burritos and tacos.  I am partial to carne asada and carnitas primarily, and both of these are executed competently here.  And while it's possible to obtain the above-mentioned inappropriate ingredients here, it's easy to decline these with a suitably insulted or horrified facial expression.

To date I've been fairly underwhelmed by the burrito shops in San Francisco, including the ones in the Mission that everyone raves about.  For my money, Gordo Taqueria is at least as good as the others I've tried, all the more surprising given the demographics of the neighborhood.
author: j b.

description:
the price is good...no parking as usual for the irving sunset area.

its soooo good.  the pork, beef, chicken, anything you order.

its worth the wait if there is a wait in line.  its not so much authentic as it is fresh and tasty.

my favorite part of the place?  the salsa....its worth buying and adding to your burrito or taco while you eat.  more is better.
author: Bing D.

description:
I come here for the boiled chicken burritos and quesadillas.

I think I like the burritos here because there is a lot of juices.  If you aren't careful it might drip all over your pants lol.

Other places have better ratings but I find their burritos to be dry and not as tasty as this place imo.
author: Charles K.

description:
Gordo is exactly what I would be if I lived closer to this place! DOGGON
GOOD FOOD! The burritos have beans which are left unmashed, which gives a nice texture. The meat, fresh and delicious! My husband orders because he speaks the language, the guys are very nice and very quick!!!
I highly recommend this great place !
author: Jan C.

description:
The burritos here are totally over rated but the quesadilla carnitas taco on a corn tortilla is the best thing they serve here, it's not on the menu but you've gotta try at least once. 

Definitely a staple in San Francisco
author: Michelle L.

description:
Went to Gordo's this weekend remembering how tasty their burritos are.  It had been a couple of years since my last visit. The reason for this review is not the quality of the food but the fact that these guys will
try to rip you off any way they can.  They no longer offer free tortilla chips, and the burritos are super small.  Not big and juicey like before.
They skimp on everything. Will never return.
author: Marie R.

description:
This kills me.  I really, really want to like Gordo's.  I keep forgetting my prior experiences and getting burritos from here, only to be disappointed yet again.  I know many people who love the place, people to go there at least once per week like they are going to church on Sunday. But, the fact is that Gordo's kinda sucks.

Gordo's has no place in a city with so many great Taquerias: Pancho Villa, Papalote, El Metate, etc.  There is far to much bland, mushy rice ralative to the meat, not that it matters too much, since the meats don't have much flavor either.  I gave the carnitas several tries before going with the boiled chicken tonight.  Such raves over the boiled chicken!  I couldn't figure out how this would taste like anything else other than chicken... boiled.  Bleh.  And I was right.  Not bad, per se, but as bland as the bland rice.

Overall a Gordo's burrito is a bland gut-bomb that you keep stuffing into your face, expecting that each bite will somehow contain tastiness, but to no avail.  Go elsewhere, even if you have to leave the Inner Sunset.
author: Joe M.

description:
I almost always stop by Gordos whenever I am in that neck of the woods, even if I'm supposed to be eating at somewhere else.  Their steak burritos are awesome, while the chicken burritos are hit-or-miss.  Sometimes the chicken is perfectly cooked, other times they're way too moist and way too salty.  

One point off because of the hit or miss chicken, and because they close way too early.  Drunk me + a horrible hankering for mexican food + a closed Gordos = super emo angsting! ...But that's a story for another time.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Good for the price, but that's about all this place is good for.

I usually just get the chili verde burrito, with some pickled jalepenos, crema, and salsa? (is that really salsa- usually it is just unripe pica di gallo).

It's good when you are starving and only have 6 bucks on ya.
author: frizzle-fry e.

description:
Where do I go? 
Where do I go?  
Where should I take my lunch break today?  
Gordo's? 
Mmmm I love the carnitas at Gordo's.  
A taco or quesadilla?  
No, I really shouldn't though.  
I'm trying to be healthy.  
Well, just get one thing.  
Ok.  
Yay!
Gordo's!

Finally arrives at Gordo's 7 minutes later.  
"Can I get one carnitas taco... and a carnitas flour quesadilla?"

Dammit.  I just can't resist.
author: Kat R.

description:
The old standby. Before you were cool and drove a car, you bused it on the 29 or the 28 to Gordo's. You peeled back the aluminum foil, bit off a piece of burrito deliciousness, and washed it down with a sip of Jamba Juice. Because Jamba Juice was also so so cool. 

Then you grew up and you got a car or a cool older boyfriend with a car. You busted out of the Sunset without looking back because it was "too pedestrian" and you found your way to the Mission. You stopped washing your hair and started to wear "vintage" clothes. You only ate at "authentic" Mexican spots like Paplote, El Metate, El Farolito, and La Taqueria. And Gordo's faded from your hipster memory. Remember your roots: it's okay that you once popped your collar. All is forgiven. 

Gordo's delivers cheap burritos back in the old stomping grounds. Not your hippest or freshest friend, but, nevertheless, a friend indeed.
author: Kari M.

description:
I like good plain food. Don't put shrimp and crazy stuff on my burrito to make it good.
Just have good ingredients and I will love it. Gordos delivers.
Had a carnitas burrito (carnitas had great flavor) and bean and cheese quesodilla (amazing, small and good, cheap too). He made it all warm and buttery or something. He basically made my day with it.
Good prices, tasty food with no crazy bells and whistles. 
Worth a try. I'm going back.
author: Wendy K.

description: Gordo's is famous among College students and parents alike for their cheap, easy, quick, filling and hearty burrito's. I've been coming here since I was a little kid and the food is always good. They serve what I call the best "white-person" burrito in the city. If your in the Sunset and looking for a Pizza alternative Gordo's is definitely a good option.
author: Samuel P.

description:
Man, how can you say no to that Carne Asada.... Gordo's ain't flashy like Taco bell or the McDonalds with the little playland in the back,  but you get some good clean fun and exactly what you pay for when you come here. Don't come here for no mexican-california-french-vietnames-port reduction-micro greens-fusion. It's just straight up clean mexican food. Something about that juicy sweet lucious carne asada that just hits me in my mouth and makes me remember why devour animals on a daily basis.For a sweet deal, the Gordo's plate will always feed the kids back home. 

I dunno I've eaten at a few other legendary SF Taqueria's like El Farolito and Ocean Taqueria and they just didn't do me like Gordo. 

I wish I could give it a 5 stars, but minus a star for the burrito builders who gets shady with the service unless you're a girl with a smokin' body.
author: clint t.

description: Pretty Lame Burritos.  Too Dry.  Too Salty.   La Avenida and La Fonda are way better - and right around the corner.  Skip Gordo.
author: Adam D.

description:
If a homeless guy standing outside Gordo's asks for food. Give the man food. I walked out, burrito in hand and made the mistake of giving him a pocket full of change. Holding the change, he looked at what I had given him and threw it all in the street! 

What is the saying? Beggars can't be choosers? Makes me glad I didn't give him my burrito because it was good.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Of the three Gordos in SF, this is by far the best. Of course, it's not the mission, but if you live in the area and want a delicious, and clean burrito this is the place to go. 

One reason I love this place is that they give you exactly what they ask for, none of that "well how did I end up with this in my burrito, I don't remember asking for it" which happens half the time in the mission. It's also a great place to take picky eaters (aka the brother that doesn't eat anything interesting).

Another reason I love it is you'll be hard pressed to find another burrito better than this in the sunset.

My favorite item to get here are the quesedillas, they are cooked to a perfection you can't even find in the mission. I'm hungry even thinking about it.

It's always cold inside, but on a nice day it's great to get your burrito go to and walk across the street to the arboretum to eat.
author: Allyson S.

description: I went this past weekend for a Memorial Day mini vacation to San Francisco, I was starving all day and was craving Mexican food, I found this place via my iPhone maps, decided to go and try it out, the guy behind the counter who prepped my food was a big light completed Hispanic dude and was cool and did everything I asked on the super burrito, it was time to pay with the guy who everyone on yelps says is an a-hole on here, I'm a 6 foot in shape tatted dude from inner city LA and he must've sensed it cuz he was real nice to me and even said thank you so I was surprised when I read that he was an a-hole. However, I sat down to eat my food and that's when I saw it for myself, the guy lived up to the reputation of an a-hole, now as I stated earlier I'm from south central LA so I don't mind dudes trying to be funny or whatever but this guy had a shtick of being obnoxious, arrogant and rude and wasn't funny at all, it was a problem to me because there were kids (Hispanic) and a white young couple there so both groups found and understood what he was saying to be volatile, the food was ok, but to be fair I'm from a city where there is a taco stand literally in every corner. So with that being said, I hope management or someone from that restaurant reads these reviews and I don't want anyone to get fired but at least reprimand him
author: Jay C.

description: Mediocre overall. And what are they doing charging for chips and salsa when every other place gives it for free? Try La Fonda around the corner, forget this place.
author: Katie S.

description: I live in the Mission. No, I used to live in the Mission, and I've been to every burrito place in SF. Farolito's is great, El Metate has given me food poisoning, Papalote is pretty good as well, but nothing can beat Gordo. Just get a Carne Asada Super Burrito with Extra Hot Sauce, and you can puke me later. Yes, it is the size of a small fetus. *Please do not picture that while eating. It is delicious beyond whatever crappy tuna casserole your mom claims is your favorite dish. They take the tortilla and melt cheese on it before piling on all of the greatness to be finally topped off with their hot sauce. The burrito-istas are not a talkative bunch, and some do a better job than others, as in less dripping from the meat and a better wrap of foil-to-fetus.  Just don't ask them where they go their eyelids tattooed?!!!
author: Mike C.

description:
Mmmm, guilty pleasure!  The best pinto beans, and for some reason, they have the best sour cream in the city!

Perfect booze mop!!!!
author: Andy G.

description:
It is what it is.  A small mexican food chain that will usually give you the same consistent product every time you go in.  I eat there a few times a week because it's close to work and easy to grab if I'm in a hurry.  For under $5, I get a taco (with guacamole), chips and a drink.  

The tacos definitely  need the hot sauce and a little salt.  The first time going there, they didn't ask if i wanted any hot sauce and I thought it was the most bland thing ever.  And their guac?  Yummers.  

And for the love of god, don't let them steam your corn tortilas without throwing them on the flat top first.  They were busy and the guy did this, and it stuck to the paper rendering them useless.
author: Coral C.

description: Big portions and at a great price. Their carnitas is the best. I highly recommend.
author: Cortney A.

description:
Yay Gordo's!
Burritos are very tasty. Love it.
The only problem I have with this place is that the guys are so rude. They say the most horrible things in spanish (I guess they dont know Im fluent...)
Someone needs to slap them with a burrito....oh nevermind, dont waste such a delicious thing on them.
author: Judith F.

description:
***4.5 stars!***

This is the second best burrito place in San Francisco (La Taqueria, of course, being the first).  However, sometimes, you just don't feel like going to the Mission.  How many times must you risk your life because usted no habla Espanol or because you're undecided on your gang affiliation?

Seriously, though, If you're lucky enough to live in the Sunset or have the time to look for a parking spot in the area, consider stopping by Gordo Taqueria.  There are a few tables in the joint, but I always take the food to go and eat it with a fork and a knife.  

Gordo burritos are HUGE and tasty.  They're bursting with flavor of all that juicy meat, rice, beans, guacamole, sour cream and salsa you can handle.  Quesadillas are pretty awesome, too.  Gordo gives you lots of meat, and all of it (I've had chicken, steak and carnitas) is really good.  All the ingredients are super fresh, too.  Gordo is hardly good for your diet, but opt for boiled chicken instead of grilled if you're counting calories.  The boys here don't skimp on the butter, though, so I don't know if boiled chicken will help.

Prices are reasonable ($5.50 for a super burrito, $4.50 for a quesadilla) and you get a free bag of tortilla chips, too.  What a bargain!
author: Yan G.

description:
Always clean, always gets your order right. This is a mission-syle burrito joint in the inner sunset. If you don't like the seating, take your to-go burrito to eat in the park, or around the corner at The Little Shamrock. 

The only gotcha is they close at 10 sharp. Do not be late!
author: Angela A.

description:
When visiting my friend in San Fran, the first thing on our to-do list was to go to Gordo's.  You might say that I am crazy for picking a fast-food Mexican as my go-to place in ALL of San Fran.  You also may be thinking that just because I'm from Jersey I don't know what good Mexican food tastes like.  Let me assure you that I know what I'm talking about, especially when it comes to Gordo's...or at least its burritos.  You can really taste every ingredient separately, unlike most burritos where they are mashed together.  The burritos taste so fresh, not like most fast-food.

Quick Tips
1. Don't be afraid of getting a dry chicken in the burrito.  The chicken is moist and flavorful
2. If you like your burrito spicy, ask for extra hot sauce!
3. The guacamole and sour cream are at an extra cost in the burrito, but it's definitely worth to get anyway.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
i really don't see what's so great about gordo, i mean i not saying its bad, but i don't think its as good as everyone says it is. I had way better before. 

I ordered the chicken super burrito, the chicken was really moist, and i like how they don't charge you for sour cream and guacamole! AWESOME! but i still had better then gordo.
author: Brian P.

description:
I love Gordo's.  I usually get a burrito here once a week.  

I always try to get my burritos "healthier" and Gordo's does one of the best jobs of it.  They have wheat tortillas, grilled chicken, black beans and awesome guacamole (for my splurge.  I can't give THAT up too).  I get mine without rice and it's still a huge burrito for cheap.  Plus, they don't charge extra to NOT have things in your burrito.  

When I feel like being bad, their quesadillas are awesome.  Don't get a quesadilla expecting it to be a standard, flat "tortilla grilled cheese" becuase they don't do 'em like that at Gordo's.  They resemble burritos and have all the same stuff but they're dipped in oil and crisped on the griddle.  Yummy.

If you give this place 1 or 2 stars it signals this to me, 1) that you're one of those annoying people that can't decide what/how much they want and irritate not just the guys behind the counter (who rightly insult you in Spanish) but also everyone else in line and 2) probably give La Taqueria 5 stars which signals to me that you have no idea what you're talking about anyway.
author: M M.

description:
I popped in for a quick bite, and got chips with guac, and a carnitas quesadilla.  The guacamole was pretty ballin, and I greatly enjoyed it.

However, the carnitas were out of this world.  While a little greasy, they were right up there with the best of what Arizona had to offer.  Too legit.

Only drawback is that they forgot to get me the quesadilla at first.  Initially, I didn't care, but so many people came in ordering food with carnitas, I had to go back and get it.
author: Robert S.

description:
I don't care what anyone says.  Best burrito in town.  I always hated burritos before Gordo's, but now I'm addicted!  I particularly like that they have smaller burritos... who needs the extra 600 calories?

One complaint, though - they don't have nachos!  Once, Heather and I were craving for nachos, and came up empty handed.  El Farolito's has more selection and more authenticity, but Gordo's burrito trumps theirs.
author: Serena Y.

description:
Special on al pastor tacos for $1.25 each = fantastic value.

Otherwise, average to above average tacos and burritos.  A little too much rice and beans for my taste.  Definitely worth visiting if I'm in already in the neighborhood and need to grab a quick bite, but by no means a "destination."
author: Leon R.

description:
Summary: Don't!

Been here twice recently to confirm first experience wasn't just someone having a bad day...but I would avoid Gordo:

Just had burritos, but they really weren't very flavorful.  Counter staff was short with me on both occasions despite not being busy.  Menu is a bit confusing...admittedly it might be "user error" but at Gordo a "Super Burrito" doesn't mean it includes guac and sour cream like every other Mexican joint I've been to in SF, but means a bigger size...that sour cream is gonna be extra.  Both times I left with something different and more expensive than I though I was ordering, and then disappointed by the food itself.  I would avoid this place.

Alternatives: L'Avenida on Irving bet. 6th and 7th for good Mission-style food, or La Fonda on Irving bet. 7th and 8th for ok "healthy" Mexican.
author: Steve E.

description: this place sets the bar pretty high for mexican fast food,i always get the burrito and usually take one for the road too
author: Steve M.

description:
This spot has two saving grace in my opinion, it's cheap, and it's the better of the two taquerias in the inner sunset.  For about $5 bucks you can get a regular, and for $6 you can get a super.  
   The burritos are decent size, and ok quality, but the guys who roll them, must have rolled to many in their day since you never know if it's even going to be wrapped properly. Granted if I had to serve hundreds of burritos a day to sniveling yuppie bastards I probably wouldn't care if everyone was actually rolled properly.  Think of it as acceptable losses, most get through, but some just never make.
   Another thing to note, they charge for chips, which always seems a bit strange to me.  In a world where one can buy 20 pounds of chips for $12 at Costco, you'd think that would be considered a part of natural overhead cost, but I guess Gordo's gotta get fat in more ways than one.
author: Nathan C.

description: I became a huge fan of burritos after i ate here! its just amazing nuff said! I would come here every other day if i could OMG..i so want one right now! anything would work with guac+sour cream+tomato ahhhhhhh *drools*
author: May D.

description:
Hated. Loathsome. Yuck. Particularly the carne asada, which is bland and chewy.  Also bland and raw-onion-dominated is the Pico de Gallo.

(Others like it.)
author: Teal H.

description:
Definately one of the BEST burritos I've ever had. It's always busy, esp during lunch/dinner time. The seating is limited, best for take-out. The super burrito is more than enough to fill you up. I always get either the carnitas--(really good!) super burrito with guacamole and sour cream & hot sauce, or the super with grilled chicken. I love how gordo's tortilla's are Super thin since I don't really like packaged tortillas. They also have spinach/tomato tortillas upon request.

Would give 5 stars, but the guys who make the burritos are perverts!
author: Jessica h.

description:
Decent,reasonable prices and quite good if you have a particular craving.

The place isn't to big,but you can dine there or get take out.I prefer to take out.I usually just get a burrito when I come here.
author: Dani D.

description:
I hate to judge a place on one visit but....
the carnitas was boring as hell and they guy taking my order made me feel like an asshole for requesting no salsa (I have an intense hatred for cillantro. It rapes your mouth and makes you taste nothing else). 
I now live within 10 blocks of two Gordos, but I usually trek to the Mission when I have a Mexi-craving. Maybe I'll give it another shot, but my initial experience was lame.
author: Lauren T.

description:
Hungry for lunch after getting off the bus on 9th, we pretty much stumbled into the first open place.
Lucky for us, we had stumbled into Gordo Taqueria!
We had a chicken and beef burrito, and they were really good.
Quick service. Good Guac and chips! Great prices.
Will definately go back, when in the neighbourhood.
author: David H.

description: Extremely mediocre burritos. No thanks, rather just grab a burger next door.
author: Nick J.

description: Such a refreshing burrito. See, San Diego burritos are made with lots of lard and salt so having a burrito from Gordo (first name basis) is like a drinking lemonade on a warm summer day. I never knew I could feel like I am not dying after eating a Bean Cheese and Rice burrito, for that you get 5 stars.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I work in Golden Gate Park so this place is super convenient, and CHEAP!

Somehow though, my order always comes out to being $6.66.  Usually the cashier only charges me $6.65... out of superstition?  Perhaps, perhaps.  

REGARDLESS!!  I usually get a veggie burrito.  The hot sauce is spectacular.  My only gripe would be to have sliced tomatoes separate from the salsa.  Oh well.  

Good items to take to the park and eat!  Yay Gordo!
author: Kristina K.

description: Man I like this place whenever I get an urge for a flour carne asada quesadilla with salsa, guac and loads of hot sauce. Makes my mouth water just thinking about it. If you want a burrito, ahh better go somewhere else because the super burrito ain't that super in fact it's pretty Clark Kent-ish. Not loaded up at all. Their plates are ok but there's something about a home made style salsa that they prepare there that lets the tomatoes, onions, and such that does the talking for the rest of the dish.  They do the salsa right and the tacos are pretty good when paired with their salsa and hot sauce. Been going here since high school after our baseball games and after all these years...it still hits the spot.
author: graham c.

description:
As you can see from my "Last Meal on Earth" section of my profile, I think this place is kind of ok.

I also like that every time I come to visit (I live in NY now), the SAME guys are working there, and I'm going back to about 1995 now.

I can't seem to find the option to add another 5 stars.
author: Michael Z.

description: Great place to come for a $5 'rito. Filling and won't break the bank. Fast (though sometimes not the friendliest) service. But these guys work hard. I will come back again. That is, unless a Chipotle ever opens up closer to home.
author: Ray C.

description: Seriously Folks,....Everyone who loves a good burrito in Sf knows you can find a super excellent burrito at quite a few places,....but the quesadillas at Gordo Is like heaven..flavorful, crunchy, but rolled into a burrito like bundle of ultimate love. You can fill it with anything you want just like a burrito, I got pork, salsa, pica de gallo,..sourcream guac etc..etc.. you know...but I have to say, this was THE SH*T!!!! I have eaten at all the cool spots, many times over in the last 9yrs i've lived here, but this surpasses all expectations...If you haven't had it, get it, better than a chimichanga...
author: l m.

description:
I almost always get the grilled chicken super burrito with no beans, extra rice.  Oh and some hot sauce please. $5.

Their quesadillas are good too cuz they are grilled and crispy.  But I love mexican rice so I usually get the burrito.
author: Serena H.

description:
myeh.

The corn tortillas on my chicken tacos were so thick.  I was pretty bummed out about my tacos until I chucked the tortillas and used the chicken as chip topping.  Mmmm.  Much better. 

Good guac.  Nothing spectacular but good.

I didn't see any refried beans and was only offered pinto or black.  Do they seriously not have refried beans?

To their credit, the guy loaded my tacos (hee hee that sounds nasty) and both guys working the counter were cool.  

Oh another thing I didn't like was they don't give out free salsa.  

But you get as much soda from the fountain as you want, which right now with this raging hangover, sounds amazing.

I think I like La Fonda better.  Probably b/c of their salsa bar b/c La Fonda's no great shakes either.
author: Staci M.

description:
Gordo has the most delicious burritos in the city in my opinion.  Perhaps not the most authentic, but it more than satisfies anytime I have a craving for Mexican.  Even moreso than a lot of the taquerias in the Mission, and I've tried quite a few of them.  A big plus is that they're well put together and don't fall apart as soon as you unwrap the foil and take your first bite.

My favorites are the steak or the chile verde with cheese, refried beans, salsa, guac and sour cream.  Your stomach will thank you (although your hips probably won't.)
author: Christine C.

description:
I'm a simple man. I don't expect a revolutionary or transcendent experience from a burrito. I want something delicious and filling. Something good enough that when I'm totally full from the first, I want a second although I just can't go there. Me? I'm a super bean & cheese guy. Gimme the tomato tortilla, lots of hot sauce and salsa, hold the guac and sour cream. I wait for the first bite and nostalgic for it by the last bite. Damn good burritos.

Yes, the parking sucks. Yes, its not pretentious. It's just a neighborhood joint that makes a great burrito (or quesadilla). 

4 stars.
author: Gary C.

description: I dislike this Gordos the most. The guy making the burrito is sloppy, skimps on the meat, and drenches the quesadilla in too much clarified butter. If you want a descent Gordo burrito go to the Clement one.
author: Jae Young S.

description: I was seriously last looking forward to trying Gordo's in Sunset since the two in Richmond were decent. But when I went there to make an order, but closed minutes earlier than scheduled. When I asked if they can make it to-go, the cashier said they were closed. I don't understand how hard it is to make a burrito. Laziest bunch of workers you can find. Fortunately, there are plenty of other places opened that accept business. Negative rating.
author: R L.

description: This place is quite clean for a Taqueria, and they have a pretty O.G menu. It's straight up your basic burrito, quesadilla, and taco joint. They're prices are quite reasonable- pretty cheap at that. I wish they had a more detailed description of what goes in their food as not every taqueria makes their food in an identical manner. I ordered two carnitas tacos, and the man put beans  in my taco. Never in my life had I seen beans in my taco, and he slapped some salsa with tomatoes on it! What happened to my good ol' onion and cilantro only taco? If I had known or been asked if I wanted that in the taco I would have said no, but instead he went ahead and just made it. I give it up to these fors for giving friendly customer service, and having cheap food. When it comes to the mechanics of their menu- minus one. Taste- minus one for lacking in some salt (some salt is good for flavor, of course). Blow flies in the bathroom- Minus one!! No horchata? :( minus one! Convenience and location, plus one.
author: Monina C.

description: Fresh carnitas, I love the big juicy lumpy pieces of meat that they slice up right in front of you!...so far I haven't found another burrito place that makes their carnitas that juicy n' fresh. Gordos never disappointed so far! Will continue going back. YUMMM* !
author: Ree W.

description:
I wanted something light so I tried this place out.  My bad, I should of just had a banana or apple instead.

So, for me a light bite to eat before going some running in the evening is a chicken quesadilla.

So, I order a chicken quesadilla with sour cream and gucamole.  Not too heavy right?  Well, a large quesadilla was the problem, it was a wet dripping quesadilla.  The thing looked like a burrito after the guy was done preparing it.  The sauce from the chicken was pouring out!  I've had a lot of quesadilla's in my time and they are traditionally server in either a flour/corn tortilla that is folded in half and relatively flat.  Mine was rolled like a burrito.

While eating it, the thing was falling apart.  I had to grab a fork to eat the rest of the quesadilla.  I wasn't impressed.  The taste was so-so. 

Server was okay.

Ratings:

Food presentation:  1/5
Price:   2/5
Quality of food:  3/5 (chicken was alright)
Would I come back?  Nah
author: k l.

description: Gordo's is a pretty good taqueria.  I used to think it was exceptional until I tried El Burrito Express and El Farolito.  What can I say?  It's a city for burrito fetishists like me.  Yum!
author: Desmo K.

description: DELICIOUS, fast, cheap mexican food. 'nuff said.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Fat, tasty burritos. Hasn't changed in 20 years. This is a curse and a blessing. Mostly, they're just pretty basic. If you are very specific in your order, they can be pretty good.
author: Patrick S.

description: The service is fast and the food good... Not so sure about the salsa they serve with the chips but everything else is yummy...
author: Merit P.

description:
Awesome burritos!

For those nice folks who are from OUT EAST, don't worry, it is "authentic" for what it is which is taqueria food.
author: Ricardo O.

description: My flour quesadilla was very yummy - I was quite surprised. I didn't expect much from this place since it was cold (no heater) on a crazy freezing late night and empty. I ordered the one with beef, and the meat was alot tastier than other places I've tried. I'll come back for this for sure!
author: buddie l.

description:
Prior to walking into Golden Gate Park for the Bluegrass festival we hopped off the N train and proceeded to walk down to grab a bite to grub on. So I have said it once and I will say it again- SF and mexican food don't always agree with me. Not to be a snob but mexican food doesn't have to be complicated- the simpler the better, anything that is too frou frou turns me off. When you invest more time and thought into your decor than your food I head for the hills. With this said: I liked this spot A LOT!
I love tacos al pastor so I ordered one and a quesadilla (which are the best things ever) but lets face it how hard is it to f**k up a quesadilla. Well I have had my share of disappointing quesadillas but not here. It was simple and yummy, perfectly toasted flour tortilla and not some slop some fool threw together...so over all this taqueria has my stamp of approval and it was quick and clean and fresh. A sure plus in my book...you will be seeing me again GORDO!
author: Yolanda O.

description: Never eat here. Sloppiest, most unruly burrito ever made, and I'm including that woman in South Park in this assessment. Tasted ok, but impossible to eat.
author: Mason G.

description: Been coming here for a long time. Best gringo burrito around. Also, as many taquerias have been getting more and more pricey, gordo's is still a good deal. You get a fatty burrito for 6.5. easily two meals worth, even for my big a**. Gotta go with the super carnitas.
author: Parker H.

description:
Gordo's is the place by which all other burritos are measured in my book.  A little history before I go on with the review.  I first had a Gordo's burrito when I came to visit my brother in SF in 1997.  I was living in Texas at the time.  After I went back to Texas, I actually had dreams about the burrito.  THIS IS NOT AN EXAGGERATION.  It was that good.

Things I like about Gordo's:
1) the Carnitas is the best, juicy, flavorful, and a little crispy at the edges.
2) they melt the cheese on the tortilla when they steam it prior to making your burrito.  This may seem like a minor detail, but to me, it really makes a difference.
3) the hot sauce is GOOD.
4) Carnitas
5) prices are beyond reasonable
6) they will make whatever you order, exactly how you want it
7) all the meat options are really good (Carnitas, Pollo asada, Carne asada, Pollo (boiled).  I haven't tried the verde)
8) have I mentioned the carnitas?

My favorite is a Super Burrito, Carnitas (duh!), pinto beans, rice, tomatoes, cheese, and sour cream.  No, I don't like Guacamole.  Although, I have also enjoyed the tacos and quesadillas.  The black beans are also good.

Was Gordo's the only reason I moved to California, no.  But it was definitely a consideration.
author: Justin H.

description: after constantly hearing praise of this place from a mutual friend, my friend and i decided to give gordo's a try.. once, i took my first bite of my burrito i didn't like it at all but my friend didn't think it was too bad. since our first time at gordo's i've been here several more times but it's still not that much better than the first visit. the reason we go to this place is because it's close by and cheap.. i've had their chicken, carnitas, and beef super burritos. my friend that told us about this place still continues to rave about gordo's and think we're crazy for not liking this place more.. if i want a better tasting burrito i'd rather go to the mission for el farolito or heck, i'd even take chipotle..
author: Raquel T.

description: a fat ass burrito with no flavor . pastor too salty , had better to be honest
author: NAEL K.

description:
We don't go anywhere else for a "BOILED CHICKEN SUPER BURRITO WITH EVERYTHING + HOT SAUCE", but HERE! I don't know how their other meats are, but I have tried their Quesadilla once and did not like it (Go to El Farolito for quesadillas!).

Their salsa (tomatoes) is nothing fancy; it's very plain actually, but I don't mind it in my burrito cause it tastes fresh.

5 stars for the boiled chicken super burrito, plenty of seating (unlike their Clement St. location) + very close to Golden Gate Park. 


DISLIKES:
Parking 


We travel from 20 minutes away and come here on average 2-3x a month :)
author: Jennifer C.

description: Came by to give it another try. A regular basic burrito (meat, beans, rice, hot sauce) will go for less than $5. When you ask for anything else they will charge on top, i.e. cheese, guacamole, spinach tortilla, sour cream and I think its like 50 cents extra for each. They offer super burritos, and this has to be the only place in SF, that doesn't offer sour cream guacamole as a standard with a super. And chips and salsa is a separate order.
author: Robin L.

description: The tacos are quite generously portioned and the price is right. There are plenty of seats, the kind that make you improve your posture, even around the peak of lunchtime. But I must also voice the crushing disappointment I felt at the total absence of horchata. Alas.
author: Kat A.

description: The burritos are cheap here.  It .425 and 5.25 - 4.95 for super without the cheese, guac and sour cream,.  You have to pay extra for chips and salsa.  There is a soda fountain fill yourself i assume free refills.
author: John F.

description:
Your Gordos experience will very much depend on what you get and what your  Expectations are.
Have you wandered into the land of fog from the mission looking for a super carne asada or al pastor? If so, march on back to the sunnier side of the city because you are about to be sorely disappointed.
The hands down best thing at Gordos is the quesadilla. Whether corn or flour, they are dipped in oil and fried with cheese (yes, you have officially entered a place loosely translated as Fatties). Top that with either some mouth watering carnitas or boiled chicken and you are good to go partner. Get a Gordos plate with carnitas and you will be equally satisfied. If you do decide on a burrito, remember that Gordos burritos are the melty cheesy kind and that the usual king of meats, carne asada, is sub-par here.
At the end of the day, if you know what to get, Gordos will satisfy you in a very unique way as compared to a mission taqueria, and thus, it should not be treated as such.

P.S. Gordos has some of the best chips in the city, if not the best. They're deep fried goodness!
author: Mark K.

description: I used to love this place about 4 years ago, but now I had no clue what i was thinking. I guess maybe after trying the authentic burritos from the Mission district, it probably overshadowed this place.The burritos here just seem to taste generic and bland. I ordered a steak super burrito with rice, pinto beans, guacamole, sour cream, and cheese last night but for some reason I didn't love it. It was edible but unsatisfying. I would eat  Chipotle over this any day which I actually did today =)
author: Sandra W.

description:
what can I write that hasn't been written by others. hmm. don't park in the mortuary lot across the street ! you will have some irate mourners coming after you. throw a hot taco at 'em, that oughta keep them back.

anyhow. decent burritos and tacos but nothing stupendous or memorable. parking on Irving or Lincoln Way from Funston up to 2nd Avenue really sucks the biggest salami but there are some lots around. is Gordo worth the hunt for a space ? eh. drive up to L'Avenida on Irving & 6th, I think their food runs circles around Gordo. and the service will be smiley and not cranky or abrupt either. these fellas woke up on the wrong side of the border or something
author: Prima D.

description:
as expected there will be much debate over the "best mexican food in the bay area" but this is the horse i am riding to glory. gordo is understated and no-frills and the food is off the chain. i've never gotten anything i wouldn't order two of next time. once, while tipsy, i ordered my favorite burrito, inhaled it on the way home and then my stomach promptly rejected it. so, i did the obvious thing and marched back down there and bought another one which stayed firmly lodged in my corpus and sent me to shangri-la. hooray for binge eating!!

affordable and delectable; this is everything i want in a burrito|mexican spot. i am going to have them cater my wedding and then i will get divorced so that i can do it again.

and as for the clowns who complain about the 'service' - give it a rest. it's a cafeteria-model burrito joint, there are no sommeliers, no chefs in white hats and no maitre'ds. you order what you want and you get it and sit down and stuff your face. simple, easy and satisfying.

menu tips for the challenged:
pollo blanco in your burrito
carnitas quesadilla - corn
author: W G.

description: I have been going to this gordos when i am nearby, Its not as good as the one on clement for some reason. I usually get boiled chicken rather than grilled chicken because its too burnt. I noticed that getting the burrito with everything on it is really good. So beans, rice, cheese, guac, sour cream, hot sauce and meat and extra tomatoes, if you skip out on 1 its on the same. I give them 4 stars because their food is consistent in taste, but they dont get 5 because the workers never smile when taking my order I feel like i am in the cafeteria line. But they do smile when there is a pretty girl then they put on a perverted smile.
author: DOM d.

description: You can't say your from San Francisco and not have eaten at Gordos. There quesadillas are the best. They fry em on the grill and once you've had theirs, its hard eating them any other way. But the name is true, you also can't eat her and not get Gordo.
author: S. M.

description: Gordo's is average Taqueria fare. It's not outstanding-OMG-good, but it's good enough. I work close by, so when I'm in the mood for food that will eventually make me fat or kill me, I go here. It's standard.
author: Tash T.

description: F-Gordo. My mom loves this place for some reason...so as a nice daughter  which I can be at times.  I was in the hood so I decided to pick some up for her. They are so unfriendly and have a major attitude...Hello, its not my fault you don't want to be at work and hate the world. I hate giving my money to peeps who treat me like shit but hey my mom like Gordos...almost no meat in the 2 plates I ordered, maybe 1 ounce at the most..the Carnitas I tried from moms were way too salty and the refried beans were sweet the Carne Asada was crap. I will not go back to Gordos even though we have been going since I was little, what a shame.
author: Dee D.

description: Prices are amazing, but not the carnitas burrito. All the meat was fatty and dripping with oil. I could not eat a single bite. I hope that I went on a bad day because the price and the service was great.
author: Tricia M.

description: Ummm did somebody say dericious carnitas this way??? If they were talking about Gordo's, then yes, yes they did! Carnitas super burrito=muy excelente! I would also suggest the carnitas quesadilla...HOWEVER, if you order a quesadilla from this place, do yourself and your arteries a favor and order it with NO grease on the grill. I did not know this the first time I got one and my dilla came swimming in buckets of grease...total buzz kill. Believe me, there is enough leftover grease on that grill to suffice non-stickage :) But if you like loads of grease, then by all means! Avoid the mild salsa....no flava. The spicy pico is very spicy, but very tasty! Guac is creamy and delightful and the chips are light and salted just to my liking!
author: Amanda S.

description:
They're open late. Very good burritos. They keep it simple.
Clean facilities. Order "for here" or "to go."

I was pleasantly surprised to see a line around 9:30 pm of about 6 people and 5 people were sitting enjoying their evening meal. They're open late. 

Gordo makes grande burritos. For 4 bucks and change you get yourself about a 12 inch burrito filled with rice, beans, guacomole, cheese on spinach, flour, or corn tortilla.
author: Michael K.

description: delicious food.  I recommend the veggie burritos(mmm). best burrito place i've ever been to. awesome service! Go here!!!!
author: kay g.

description: Ok....Gordo's hands down has the best burrito around town! my friend Nicole about 3 years ago brought me this bowl with rice,meat, and beans it was great and i asked her where she got it.....GORDO'S. I went to the one 19th and geary had a burrito and i was hooked! now as for the customer service...to be honest...i like the customer service much better at the one on 19thave..but thats because the guy always hooks me up, but the burrito taste better at 9th...im sure there are other burrito places that maybe better...but i think what i like the most about this place is that they melt the cheese....i totally love it!
author: Nia W.

description: I like how they have the spinach wrap. They put a lot for stuffing but I actually recommend this other place on Mission and a block away from Excelsior more! If i find the place, I'll update this one. But the other place has steak juice leaking good into your mouth!
author: Vivian L.

description: I grew up near the place and absolutely loved their food!!! Best taqueria in SF (and I've tried a few).  Period.
author: Rosie S.

description: I have been going to this Gordos for a very long time and it has remained consistent and affordable. The ingredients are fresh, authentic and tasty. One drawback is the staff could definitely be more friendly and try to become familiar with it's customer base, as many of us are repeat. Overall a go-to place for a burrito on the low end of the burrito price range.
author: Aaron S.

description: The super burrito is not like other taquerias where the difference to a regular is more ingredients (cheese, guacamole and sour cream).  The difference here is size.  With age and wisdom comes digestion difficulty and lower metabolism.  For people who hate to leave a burrito unfinished because the butt is so delicious, get the regular size with the extra add ons.  Your old body will thank you, and you'll have the satisfaction of eating the entire thing, butt to yummy butt!  Oh, and their guacamole is excellente.
author: Denise C.

description: I don't quite get some of the raving reviews of this place.  The food at Gordo falls short of being memorable, let alone desirable.  I can think of at least twenty establishments in the city that serve a better burrito or taco.  The kiss of death is the watery guacamole, which is absolutely unacceptable.  At least the name of the place somewhat lives up its name, but unfortunately Gordo seemed to be more about quantity than quality.
author: Michael P.

description: Gordo Taqueria has been on Ninth Ave for years. Food is good at a good price. Meter parking is available but not easy to find because Ninth Ave at Irving is always busy.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Oh the high school memories of Gordo's Burritos. I have since "graduated" on to the better Mexican foods of the South Bay, but still reminisce the lunchtime adventures to Irving St.
author: Tony L.

description: Gordo's has fed me and all of my family some of the juiciest and most delicious burritos I have ever had on a consistent basis for over 20 years. They grill all of their meat and steam their tortillas and when you combine those two components, it makes for an A+ burrito. I highly recommend this joint.  If you are looking for an affordable and fast meal, swing by and try it for yourself.
author: John G.

description:
pretty solid taqueria. definitely where i go when absolutely all dinner plans have gone bust and i end up alone and hungry in the middle of the night. 
good burritos.
author: Roy N.

description: Decent burritos, not the best, but also not the worse. It fills me up whenever I get a super burrito, so that is good. The salsa for the chips are not that great.
author: Edgar G.

description: The burritos here are definitely yummy, and I appreciate the super fresh ingredients.  Fresh ingredients always seem to make everything taste better, and the fresh cilantro and salsa really make the burritos here worth the train ride from Nob Hill to the Inner Sunset.  I highly recommend the bean and cheese burrito with salsa, guacamole and sour cream!  It's sooo delectably tasty!
author: Jacqueline T.

description: The tortillas are really doughy and the guacamole is good. The grilled chicken is definitely the choice of meat at this place.
author: Scott F.

description: good neighborhood spot. for the size of the burritos, the price is pretty damn good. i've been on an eating-out binge and have frequented this spot in the past few weeks. i find its often hard to find good mexican food outside of the mission and its nice to have a spot near my house that i can run to for a decent taco or burrito.
author: Georgia W.

description:
This place is cheap, fast, nice portions, and absolutely delicious.  It's really simple, nothing fancy.  Just solid, good food with fast and friendly service. Perfect if you have little time or don't want to make a fiasco out of lunch or dinner.  Thumbs up!

The grilled chicken super burrito is the best item I've had so far.  Taco's are tasty.
author: Travis W.

description: Been going here forever (I believe that would be the 80s) and getting tired of the recent trend:  price increases and portion decreases.  The regular size burrito is like an appetizer now with little more than a huge, gummy tortilla!  And tired of the crappy salsa with white tomatoes and onion stems. And it's clear the people working there don't really give a damn anymore and are not trained or as skilled as the staff he used to hire.  All in all it's become a very unpleasant experience.   It seems clear the owner is not interested in making this a viable operation anymore.  But we pay while he daydreams!  And all this is really sad because I think this type of place could go a lot farther in filling a void in this neighborhood if only the owner could get things back in order.  But he's probably surveyed the alternatives in the area and realized he can keep his standards pretty low before he pushes his customers to the competition.
author: j d.

description:
i wish i could give it 2 and 1/2 stars because they charge you for chips and salsa but i'll be nice and bump it up to 3 because the guac is muy bueno :)

i need to preface this review by saying i grew up in southern california (mecca of all things mexican-outside of mexico).

that said, gordos is cheap and decent. my basis for comparison is very limited with mexican food here since the first few attempts were...gross to say the least. my asada had some flavor and wasn't super fatty and chewy.  if your in the sunset and craving mexican it works.
author: rachel c.

description: After a stroll in GGP, Gordo's is the place to go. Their steak has a wonderful charcoal taste. mmmm good. Burritos used to be bigger than now, but its still big compared to other places. 2 burritos can feed 4 hungry people.
author: Colleen W.

description: So I got this certificate online and decided to finally use it.  Usually when I order a super burrito, it comes with EVERYTHING, so when they asked me if I wanted sour cream and guacamole, I said, yes.  But they actually charge extra, extra for it.  Anyway, the burrito was ok - nothing special.
author: Katniss B.

description: My favorite burrito place.  I've been coming to Gordo's for 10+ years now.  There are a few locations near me, the 9th and Irving location, the Geary location, and the Clement location.  I always get a super burrito.  Great combination of flavors, doesn't taste like a burrito you can get anywhere.  I got a chicken quesadilla once and loved it, maybe I'll get that next time.
author: Eli N.

description:
Gordo, we need to talk. 

Look, I'm sorry Gordo. I love you, but in all honesty, Chino's was there for me when I needed a burrito the most. And not only that, it was better than you ever were at filling me up. Hey, don't cry. It's not your fault you don't have spicy chicken or spinach tortillas. It's just that your cashier lady never smiles, and it makes me uncomfortable when I have to pay. 

Also, I just feel like you're not satisfying me in the way you had originally did years ago. Sure, I'd be full after a visit, but it wasn't the "good" kind of full. It was like you took my stomach, ripped it from my body, and threw it on the floor. And that really broke my heart. 

Again, I'm sorry, but I really do believe we should see other people for now, just to make sure we're not gonna regret this relationship later on in our lives, okay? Don't worry, I might still visit you when my friends are back in town, but until then, this is goodbye...
author: Joey Y.

description: Solid burrito but nothing I'd travel out of the way for.  The burritos are decent size and the meats are nicely marinated but a bit on the dry side.  No real sauce to eat with your burrito either so I got a bit tired of it towards the end.  The place is pretty clean and the service is quick which are pluses.
author: Steven H.

description: everything is very plain, pay extra for sour cream, cheese, guac... carnitas were too salty, chicken was very bland. nothing special here
author: Erik A.

description: Gordos has been one of my favorites for a long time. I'm a big burrito fan and each place just has its own style. I go to gordos for the Boiled chicken. Its the only place I know that has it. Everything always seems fresh and yes the guys usually hook you up with extra if you ask. Parking sucks here but its worth it when you find a spot. I wish there was a gordos in the south bay. I don't really like La Victoria's.
author: L K.

description: I almost feel stupid writing a review for Gordo's because it's Gordo's, man. It can't be stopped - it can only be contained. All of the meat is solid 'cept maybe the carne asada. Occasionally I'll even go veggie here. They try their best to fit as much filling in the regular tortilla as in the super which can lead to hilarious blow outs.
author: michael c.

description: Flour quesadilla with carnitas or any meat, with beans rice and salsa.  Cheaper than a super burrito almost as filling, tastier cause the tortilla is grilled or fried, its crispy.  If your really hungry get a super burrito with whatever meat you desire, grilled chickens good too. Get everything with hot sauce and jalepenos, and hot sauce on the side.  That green stuff is good with every bite.  Try to hit up the clement or 9th ave ones theyre the best and oldest.  Id say the clement one is consistently the best.  Nobody should have any complaints about the flour quesadilla like I first mentioned.  A benchmark for deli style burritos in SF.  Remember green sauce on the side with every bite.  Msg me if you are disappointed, I doubt you will.  Not as consistent as before, but gordo's has been a fav of mine since the early nineties or late eighties.
author: Hen A.

description: A journalism haunt before and after class at SFSU. Pretty darn tasty and cheap, always a plus for those of us wth exhausted wallets. Its always really shady and wonderful down on Irving by the park, and its fun to watch passers-by in their big windows or bring your dog down on a really hot day. Fast, wonderful service. Fun casual date spot. ;) Easy parking, two blocks away from the grassy pathways and trees-- and across the street from Park Chow (a hot date night rec.). Authentic, and like someone else said, not too much cilantro is always a good thing.
author: Allison B.

description: First off, people below might complain about authenticity, but what makes this burrito different from most "authentic" burrito taquerias? What is an authentic burrito? What are these yelpers comparing Gordos to? Just like most food, there are several geographical varieties of burritos. All of which are authentic with the exception of fast food burrito joints. Now to continue, Gordos is an authentic California burrito taqueria. This does not make the burrito any less or better than others. Another example, people love Panda Express and its American-Chinese selections. However, if you want a different authentic burrito, you can find it here. Just subtract the condiments from your burrito and tada! AUTHENTIC MEXICAN burrito. Now that I am done teaching about the authentic burrito, I LOVE the burritos here. My bf took me here for the first time last year and I fell in love (with the burrito). I ordered a quesadilla with rice, guac, tom sauce and black beans. MMM The chicken here is eatable!  The crispyness of the tortilla reminds me a bit like the chalupa tortillas at Taco Bell. I recommend a chicken quesadilla with all the condiments you like!
author: Jessica B.

description: Gordo's will always be one of my favorites.  I fell in love with this place when I was in 9th grade in high school.  Since we had off campus lunch, I would go here about three times a week for their cheap, fast, and delicious burritos.  The chicken was tender and moist, the rice wasn't dry, the salsa added a nice tang, and the fresh guacamole and sour cream added a flavorful smoothness to contrast all the other flavors in the burrito.  Did I mention the burritos are cheap (about $4.57)? Gordo's is my choice for Mexican food when I'm not in the Mission enjoying a quesadilla suiza from El Farolito.
author: Alan H.

description:
The gf and I were stoked to try this place on a recommendation from an acquaintance, but alas, it was pretty bad.

The burrito I got was pretty bland; Chipotle is better.  I asked for spicy salsa and was given some sort of spicy liquid out of a bottle.  The black beans were a bit undercooked, and the rice and meat were nondescript.

Also, their salsa was terrible.  I've had better from a grocery store in Wisconsin in the middle of the winter.  We're in California, and there's simply no excuse for serving tasteless, unripe tomatoes.

Spend the extra $2 and eat at Papalote or Tropisueno -- you'll be glad you did.
author: Earl H.

description: For a decent burrito in the Sunset you can't go wrong with this place.  I've been frequenting Gordo's for decades and quality is unwavering.  My favorite has always been the super bean and cheese with guac & cream.  When craving meat I'll have the grilled chicken, very flavorful cause it's nicely blackened.  Oh, and always whole black beans are a must.
author: jennifer a.

description: Love gordos, better burritos out there but this is a good staple.  The guys there are a little reminiscent of the NY Soup Nazi, but once you get your order in, leave them alone....they'll work their magic.
author: Brye L.

description: Tasty bean and cheese with guac, and you don't have to travel to the Mission!! Good tacos too, excellent hot sauce and generous jalapenos. Leaky but delish.
author: Larkin C.

description: Yep.  The greatest place I've found for Mexican outside the mission so far in the SF area.  Found it as a recommendation from an awesome chic I knew from Puerto Rico and haven't had the desire to go anywhere else, really.  Great place for anything, but I always order burritos.  Open late, so you can chill out in the area for drinks and hit this place when the hunger hits.  Gordo's doesn't have the best seating situation, so during the day, take it to go and watch suckers kick soccer balls around or throw frisbees in the park while they smell your smoltering hot and tasty dinner.  There's a nice spot to sit and relax right down the street.  Careful for the bums, though, better make it private.
author: Amy M.

description: When I come back from a trip, or a long stint away from SF - this is the go-to place for a great burrito. Nice people, great service, outstanding food. No fills honestly good burritos.
author: S s.

description: I really like Gordo.  As a former vegetarian, I just can't bring myself to have a burrito with meat.  Gordo's beans are tasty, they use just the right amount of cheese, and their salsas are good.  Don't bother with chips; they are not house-made.
author: Laura B.

description: Decent enough, but usually packed with emo douchebags and hippies smellin' the place up on their way to the park. There are much worse options in the city, but don't make a special trip to this neighborhood just for this.
author: Andrew L.

description: Once a favorite of mine (an SF native), I will never go back! Dinner Thursday night and today, Saturday, I'm still sick to my stomach. :(
author: Kerrie T.

description: Not the best, but will do.  I would recommend the quesadillas and the gordo plates.  The burritos are decent too.  The only downside is they charge you extra for guac and sour cream, and it doesn't taste authentic.
author: Joanne H.

description: pretty awesome tacos and mexican plates for an awesome price!
author: Janice M.

description: Definitely one of my favorite's although you're bound to get one of the dude's that can't roll a fucking burrito to save his life at some point.  That happened to me last time.  This guy was a little too busy talking to roll my burrito correctly so it fell apart when I unwrapped it.  Oh well.  You win some, you lose some.  This type of stuff happens very rarely though so I'm cool with it.  I just cussed him out from my table for a few minutes as I ate my burrito with a knife and fork like my grandmother.  My favorite part has to be that no matter what you order they always ask the same questions.  I say super bean and cheese (which obviously according to the title doesn't contain meat...)  and he says "whakynameet?"  No matter what you say that fool will ask you that.  Hilarious!  Comic relief+decent burrito= laughing+enjoyment+gas.
author: Chris M.

description: Not the best burrito, but a good price. The chicken is definately a lot better than the steak.  The salsa is flavorless, which is not a good thing because I love salsa! But if you spend the extra money and get double guacamole and double sour cream and hot sauce, it turns out being pretty good.
author: Sonya D.

description: I'm a huge fan of Gordo's.  If I'm in the area it's always a place to stop by to get some quick, cheap, and filling food.  Everything in this place is good... the carnitas was a little too dry for me but I usually get the beef or the chicken burrito anyway.  Parking can get difficult because there's lots of places to eat at 9th/Irving, but if you circle the block enough you usually are able to find a place to park.  I only with that the seats were more comfortable, but other than that, it's a great place to get your burrito fix!
author: Dedrick S.

description: So cheap so delicious!! im hooked! A  MUST TRY if your in the neighborhood :)
author: Jimmy B.

description: I LOVE GORDO'S!  Strongly recommend the carnitas burrito.  If I weren't afraid of gaining so much weight, I would eat here weekly.  Cheap price, great food, and the guys are friendly if you talk to them.
author: Iliana C.

description: Just like every other Gordo. Except for one crucial difference: AL PASTOR!
author: Ben P.

description: I've always found Gordo makes a great burrito... never tried anything else. Be sure to check out what's included and what's extra so you aren't disappointed. They steam the tortilla before they put all the goodness in and that seems to be part of what makes The Yum.
author: Pumpkin K.

description: This place is great for some quick eats at night.  They give pretty large portions for their burritos and will definitely hit the spot.  I think this place is reasonably priced, I personally didn't have any room for chips and salsa given the large burrito I ate.  But you do have to pay extra for those.  I had a good experience here
author: Thomas M.

description: Awesome veggie burritos! I could probably eat them once a week...maybe more. Sometimes service is a little slow, but usually it's an in-out kind of place. Perfect for when you are really hungry and want something filling, quick and cheap.
author: Barbs J.

description: Gordo's is a gem in the Inner Sunset and for that matter the entire city.  The burrito's are excellent and the price is right.  The staff is friendly.  I am partial to the all meet burrito and the chicken quesadilla.  Good food, no frills, and great folks.
author: Ben V.

description: Above-average burritos, but the place itself is not really spectacular.
author: Dennis G.

description: Good cheap burritos which are close to home and open decent hours. One thing Id change about this place though is the sheets of cheap cheese that they use.
author: Chris J.

description: Heavy on the rice and beans.  Not much in the way of guac or cheese.  The meat was a little dry, but tasted like it should.  I'd probably pass on the encore, there are just too many other choices in this town.
author: Rob U.

description: from time to time mission st. would be a bit too out of the way for me and I would be craving a burrito. Gordos would be my savior, i always order myself a super burrito on tomato wrap with the works salsa, avocado, hot sauce, hold the beans please, extra rice! Great people and Great price!
author: Wayne T.

description: So good all the time, I have never had a bad meal here.  Cash only so bring some green.   I wish they had a salsa bar, or shall I say not chintz out on the salsa, as this only enhances the meal.  Both burritos and quesadillas alike w/ steak are great.
author: Nicole F.

description: it's just like gordo's on geary. i can't say that i love this place, but when i need it... she's there for me.
author: Ameer N.

description: Woohoo!! Finally, a good quesadilla. Hands down one of the best you'll ever have. The burritos are ehh... OK, I've had better.  My personal favorite is the quesadilla if you are in the mood for something tasty, you can't go wrong with this order, plus it's cheap! Try it, let me know your thoughts, haven't had a complaint yet.
author: Joanna N.

description:
So everyone, literally everyone goes on and on about the fantastic Mexican food in San Francisco.  What they all failed to mention to me is that this is only in the mission, outside of the mission it's all pretty ordinary.  

But I can't fault Gordo for not being amazing.  For a run-of-the-mill taqueria, Gordo delivers the goods.  All I want is for someone to take a tortilla, stuff it with rice, salsa, chicken, etc. and let me be on my way.  Gordo's deliver's the goods in that regards.  A perfectly adequate taqueria gets a perfectly adequate rating.
author: Charles V.

description: Oh man. This place has great burritos for a crazy price! I have only tried the regular chicken burrito, but I always add on cheese and avocados. The regular burritos are a perfect size for lunch, because usually I find that most burritos are too big and just sit in your stomach. Not Gordo's. They are easy on the stomach and the wallet.   Get the grilled chicken, not the boiled chicken! And you have to ask for cheese if you get the regular size.
author: O K.

description: Good, but not great.  Great location, the best burrito you can get in this area for sure.  If you are really a purist head out to the Mission instead.  Bonus points for having al pastor!
author: Alex K.

description: I have been in So Cal for a while now and you would think there would be some good mexican food around, but no where compares to here. It is a bit pricey for fast mexican food but it is so worth it. As people have said, parking is tricky. It is always good to have someone in the car so you can jump out and run in while they drive around, since doubling in that busy narrow hallway they call a street is taboo. If you gotta park, take the comfort in knowing you will burn the calories you are about to eat for your expedition.
author: Ray H.

description: These burritos are SO GOOD. The boiled chicken is awesome.  Can't go wrong with Gordo's!
author: Katie W.

description: Man this place is cheap.  Just a burrito joint, but the carnitas are great here.  Personally, I tell them to give me the dried up crispy salty bits out of the meat tray.   No hot sauce around the tables, so ask them to pile it on if you like your burrito mega spicy.
author: matthew w.

description: Been eating at Gordo's back in the day since they opened...1983-84?  Too bad they don't sell t-shirts...Super beef, guacamole, sour cream, no cheese, extra salsa...That's how you order noobs!!!  Don't stand in front of me and tell the guy you want a burrito...damn that...
author: Doug E.

description:
Gordo's is my burrito joint.  At a lot of other taquerias you taste the rice, bean and meat seperately, at Gordo's they all sing together.  They also avoid over cooking their rice, the carnitas are always moist, and their hot sauce is always good.

I alway order the regular burrito with carnitas, black beans, hot sauce and sour cream (optional).  On the down side, there is some variability in the burrito construction.  Some guys behind the counter roll tortillas, and others make burrito art -- taking care to chop the carnitas, fully drain the beans, and keep the rice to meat ratio in check.
author: Justin R.

description: Every once in a blue moon i go to La Fonda and every time i am reminded of why Gordo's is the best. Others have mentioned their small menu selection and indifferent service, it's a fast food mexican joint. What do you expect? If you want a burrito that tastes like cardboard go somewhere else. If want a burrito that tastes awesome go to Gordo's. And for the record the guys behind the counter have always been friendly to me.
author: courtney b.

description: quick and cheap.  The food is ok but nothing special.  finding parking is a pain
author: L C.

description:
no nachos + no salsa bar = one very sad me.  i mean they have chips and taco ingredients....but they refused to make me nachos!

even the taco i ordered didn't come with sauce/salsa on it...i don't get it, are they just salsa haters??
author: Ambika C.

description: my friends & i went on an adventure & along the way, we got hungry.  we were near 9th & irving so we had plenty to choose from.  after browsing at a couple menus, we decided on gordo.  i haven't had gordo in a few years!  my favorite thing and probably the only thing i ever order from there is the quesadilla.  the way i order it is like a toasted burrito!  i don't just add cheese and meat...but rice, sour cream & pico de gallo too, mmm mmm! (only, next time i prob won't add pico de gallo b/c i can't stand raw onions - BLAH!) even the lady behind me asked what i ordered, "it looks so good".  that's right, it is gooooOOOOooood!  they didn't have agua fresca at this location though - porque senores?!? porquuuueeeeeee????
author: Vic S.

description: I don't understand why people like this place.  I agree with Joe M., I've tried to like this place, because it's really close to my house, but their burritos suck.  The rice is ridiculously bland and dry at that, the guacamole is watery, and the meat doesn't have a whole lot of taste.  I can't believe they're still in business.  Give El Burrito Express a try, or La Fonda around the corner; both have way superior burritos.
author: D.C. F.

description: Good place for solid burritos to fill you up for very little dinero.  Carnitas burrito with hot sauce is my favorito, but there are lots of great things to choose from, including a great grilled chicken taco.
author: Matt H.
